definition:
to stop doing an activity before you have finished it
    từ bỏ, đầu hàng, không làm nữa dù chưa xong
examples: The game was abandoned at half-time because of the poor weather conditions.
They had to abandon their attempt to climb the mountain.

definition:
the part of the body below the chest that contains the stomach, bowels, etc
    vùng bụng

connected with the the part of the body below the chest
    (Thuộc) Bụng; ở bụng.
examples: abdominal pains

definition:
to take somebody away illegally, especially using force
    [synonym] kidnap
    Bắt cóc, cuỗm đi, lừa đem đi
examples: He had attempted to abduct the two children
The company director was abducted from his car by terrorists.

definition:
a person who abducts somebody
    Người bắt cóc, người cuỗm đi, người lừa đem đi
examples: She was tortured by her abductors.
It is thought that the woman might have known her abductor.

definition:
(formal) to accept and act according to a law, an agreement, etc
    (+ by) Tôn trọng, giữ, tuân theo, chịu theo; trung thành với
examples: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
We will abide by their decision

definition:
the physical or mental power or skill needed to do something
    Năng lực, khả năng (làm việc gì)
    (Số nhiều) Tài năng, tài cán.
examples: She had the ability to explain things clearly and concisely.
She's a woman of considerable abilities.

definition:
to officially end a law, a system or an institution
    bãi bỏ, huỷ bỏ
examples: This tax should be abolished.
I think bullfighting should be abolished
National Service was abolished in the UK in 1962.

definition:
the fact of somebody being away from a place where they are usually expected to be
    Sự vắng mặt, sự nghỉ (học), sự đi vắng; thời gian vắng mặt, lúc đi vắng.
examples: The decision was made in my absence (= while I was not there).
We did not receive any news during his long absence.
Unbeknown to me, he'd gone and rented out the apartment in my absence.

definition:
not in the place where you are expected to be, especially at school or work
    Vắng mặt, đi vắng, nghỉ.
examples: John has been absent from school/work for three days now.
If a child is absent, the teacher notes it down in the class register.

definition:
to take something in, especially gradually
    Hấp thu
examples: Plants absorb carbon dioxide.
In cold climates, houses need to have walls that will absorb heat.
Towels absorb moisture.
The drug is quickly absorbed into the bloodstream.

definition:
existing as an idea, feeling, or quality, not as a material object
    Trừu tượng
    Khó hiểu.
examples: Truth and beauty are abstract concepts

definition:
It has colour, lines and shapes (form), but they are not intended to represent objects or living things
    Often the artists were influenced by ideas and philosophies
    [1]
    [Nghệ thuật Trừu tượng] là trào lưu hội họa đầu thế kỷ 20, vào những năm 1910 đến 1914
    Nghệ thuật trừu tượng không thể hiện đối tượng một cách hiện thực như mắt nhìn thấy mà biểu thị những ý nghĩ, cảm xúc của nghệ sĩ về một vài nét nào đó của đối tượng

to use something for the wrong purpose in a way that is harmful or morally wrong
    to treat someone cruelly or violently
    lạm dụng, lộng hành
    Lăng mạ, sỉ nhục, chửi rủa.
examples: She is continually abusing her position/authority by getting other people to do things for her
If you abuse your body now, you'll pay the price when you're older.
Several of the children had been sexually/physically/emotionally abused.

definition:
to befilled with noise and activity
    Đầy tiếng rì rầm, ồn ào
    Đầy những hoạt động
examples: When we arrived, the party was in full swing and the room was abuzz.
The air was abuzz with military helicopters.

definition:
to get used to a new place, situation or climate
    (Từ hiếm,nghĩa hiếm) Thích nghi khí hậu.
    Thích nghi với môi trường.
examples: Arrive two days early in order to acclimatize
It takes many months to acclimatize to life in the tropics
We haven’t got acclimatized to village life yet.

definition:
to give what is needed to someone
    Đáp ứng nhu cầu của ai đóCung cấp, cấp cho, kiếm cho ai đó thứ họ cần
examples: The new policies fail to accommodate the disabled.
We always try to accommodate (= help) our clients with financial assistance if necessary.

definition:
somewhere to live or stay, often also providing food or other services
    chỗ trọ, chỗ ăn chỗ ở
examples: There's a shortage of cheap accommodation (= places to live)

definition:
to happen or appear with something else
    Đi theo, đi cùng, đi kèm, hộ tống.
    Phụ thêm, kèm theo.
examples: strong winds accompanied by heavy rain
The text is accompanied by a series of stunning photographs.

definition:
skilled;very good at a particular thing; having a lot of skills
    Được giáo dục kĩ lưỡng, có đầy đủ tài năng; hoàn hảo, hoàn mĩ, tài hoa,
    (về nhạc, hoạ, nữ công,
    )
examples: She's a very accomplished pianist/painter/horsewoman.
He was accomplished in all the arts.

definition:
to explain the reason for something
    (+ for) Giải thích (cho).
examples: The poor weather may have accounted for the small crowd

definition:
the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do something skilfully without making mistakes
    sự đúng đắn, sự chính xác; độ chính xác
examples: We can predict changes with a surprising degree of accuracy

definition:
correct, exact, and without any mistakes
    đúng đắn, chính xác, xác đáng
examples: We hope to become more accurate in predicting earthquakes.

definition:
to say that somebody has done something wrong or is guilty of something
    Cáo buộc, buộc tội, kết tội; tố cáo
examples: to accuse somebody of murder/theft
She accused him of lying.

definition:
(of a goal, status or standard) that can be reached, especially by making an effort for a long time
    Có thể đạt được, có thể thực hiện được
examples: Profits of $20m look achievable.
Before you set your targets, make sure that they are achievable.
opposite unachievable

definition:
to get something
    Được, giành được, thu được, đạt được, kiếm được.
examples: He acquired the firm in 2008.
I was wearing a newly/recently acquired jacket.
I seem to have acquired (= have got although I don't know how) two copies of this book.
He has acquired a reputation for being difficult to work with.

definition:
the act of getting something, especially knowledge, a skill, etc
    Sự giành được, sự thu được, sự đạt được, sự kiếm được.
    Cái giành được, cái thu nhận được.
examples: The acquisition of huge amounts of data has helped our research enormously.
Language acquisition (= learning a language without being taught) starts at a very young age.

definition:
to decide and state officially in court that somebody is not guilty of a crime
    [opposite]convict
    Tha bổng, tha tội, tuyên bố trắng án
examples: The jury acquitted him of murder.
Both defendants were acquitted.
She was acquitted on all charges.
He was acquitted on the grounds of insufficient evidence.

definition:
a unit for measuring an area of land; 4 840 square yards or about 4 050 square metres
    Mẫu Anh (khoảng 0, 4 hecta)
examples: 3 000 acres of parkland
a three-acre wood

definition:
someone who pretends to be someone else while performing in a film, play, or television or radio programme
    Diễn viên (kịch, tuồng, chèo, điện ảnh
    ); kép, kép hát
    Nam diễn viên.
examples: "Who's your favourite actor?" "Robert de Niro
He is certainly the finest actor in Hollywood today
As an actor he could communicate a whole range of emotions.

definition:
a female actor
    Nữ diễn viên, đào hát
examples: She's the highest-paid actress in Hollywood

definition:
a Chinese method of treating pain and illness using special thin needles which are pushed into the skin in particular parts of the body
    (Y học) Thuật châm cứu
examples: Acupuncture has been practised in China for thousands of years.
I’m having acupuncture for a bad back.

definition:
An acute pain or illness is one that quickly becomes very severe
    (Y học) Cấp tínhBuốt, gay gắc, kịch liệt, sâu sắc.
examples: acute abdominal pains
It took me a while to adapt to the new job

definition:
the process of changing to suit different conditions
    Sự thích nghi.
examples: the adaptation of desert species to the hot conditions

definition:
a person who cannot stop doing or using something, especially something harmful
    Người nghiện
examples: a drug/heroin addict
a gambling addict
I'm a chocolate/shopping addict.

definition:
the need or strong desire to do or to have something, or a very strong liking for something
    Thói nghiện.
    Sự ham mê, sự say mê.
examples: cocaine addiction
He is now fighting his addiction to alcohol.

definition:
making you cannot stop doing/using it
    gây nghiện
examples: Tobacco is highly addictive
The problem with video games is that they're addictive.

definition:
enough or satisfactory for a particular purpose
    Đủ, đầy đủ
examples: Have we got adequate food for 20 guests?
I didn't have adequate time to prepare.
It's not a big salary but it's adequate for our needs
Our farm land was adjacent to the river.
There is a row of houses immediately adjacent to the factory.

definition:
to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable
    Sửa lại cho đúng, điều chỉnh
    Chỉnh lý, làm cho thích hợp.
examples: If the chair is too high you can adjust it to suit you.
As a teacher you have to adjust your methods to suit the needs of slower children.

definition:
connected with organizing the work of a business or an institution
    (Thuộc) Hành chính, (thuộc) quản trị.
    (Thuộc) Chính quyền, (thuộc) nhà nước.
examples: administrative affairs — công việc nhà nước, công việc quản lýadministrative power — chính quyền
Your responsibilities will be mainly administrative.

definition:
the time in a person’s life when he or she develops from a child into an adult (= puberty)
    Tuổi dậy thì, tuổi teen
examples: Adolescence brings about major changes in a young person’s body.
She had a troubled adolescence
yet another novel about the joys and sorrows of adolescence

definition:
a young person who is developing into an adult
    Người thiếu niên.
examples: He looked uncomfortable, like a self-conscious adolescent who's gone to the wrong party.
I'm looking after six adolescents for a week.
She doesn't understand the emotional problems of adolescents.

definition:
[[child]]to take somebody else’s child into your family and become its legal parent(s)
    Nhận làm con nuôi[[method/attitude]]to start to use a particular method or to show a particular attitude towards somebody/something
    bắt đầu sử dụng một phương pháp mới
    bắt đầu có một thái độ mới
examples: to adopt a child
All three teams adopted different approaches to the problem.
He's adopted a remarkably light-hearted attitude towards the situation.

definition:
the part of someone's life when they are an adult
    Tuổi khôn lớn, tuổi trưởng thành
examples: a child reaching adulthood
Her childhood problems persisted into adulthood
People in England legally reach adulthood at 18
Responsibility, I suppose, is what defines adulthood.

definition:
before the time that is expected; before something happens
    Trước, sớm.
examples: It's cheaper if you book the tickets in advance
People were evacuated from the coastal regions in advance of the hurricane.

definition:
having the most modern and recently developed ideas, methods, etc
    Tiên tiến, tiến bộ, cấp tiến
examples: advanced technology
advanced industrial societies

definition:
good or useful in a particular situation
    [synonym] beneficial
    Có lợi, thuận lợi
examples: A free trade agreement would be advantageous to both countries.
The lower tax rate is particularly advantageous to poorer families.

definition:
(of a person) willing to take risks and try new ideas; enjoying being in new, exciting situations
    Thích phiêu lưu, thích mạo hiểm, phiêu lưu, mạo hiểm
    Liều lĩnh.
examples: For the more adventurous tourists, there are trips into the mountains with a local guide.
Many teachers would like to be more adventurous and creative.

definition:
(informal ad) (also British English, informal advert)
    a notice, picture or film telling people about a product, job or service
    Sự quảng cáo; bài quảng cáo (trên báo, trên đài
    )
examples: Put an advertisement in the local paper to sell your car.
She scanned the job/property advertisements in the paper.

definition:
a person who supports or speaks in favour of somebody or of a public plan or action
    Người chủ trương; người tán thành, người ủng hộ
examples: He's a strong advocate of state ownership of the railways
an advocate for hospital workers

definition:
concerned with beauty and art and the understanding of beautiful things
    made in an artistic way and beautiful to look at
    (Thuộc) Mỹ học, thẩm mỹ
    Có óc thẩm mỹ, có khiếu thẩm mỹ; hợp với nguyên tắc thẩm mỹ.
examples: an aesthetic appreciation of the landscape
Their furniture was more aesthetic than functional.

definition:
​the formal study of art, especially in relation to the idea of beauty
    Mỹ học.

to have an influence on someone or something
    Làm ảnh hưởng đến, làm tác động đến; chạm đến.
examples: Farmers and market gardeners have been badly affected by the drought

definition:
a feeling of liking or love for a person or place
    (Thường + towards, for) Lòng yêu thương, sự yêu mến, tình cảm, thiện ý.
examples: Children need lots of love and affection.
He didn't show his wife any affection.
She was held in deep affection by all her students.

definition:
a particular period of history
    thời đại, thời kỳ
examples: the Victorian age
the modern age
the age of the computer

definition:
to make an illness or a bad or unpleasant situation worse
    [synonym] worsen
    Làm trầm trọng thêm, làm nặng thêm, làm nguy ngập thêm, làm xấu thêm
examples: Pollution can aggravate asthma.
Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further aggravated the problem of traffic congestion.

definition:
feelings of anger and hatred that may result in threatening or violent behaviour
    sự hung hăng, sự hiếu chiến, sự kích động, cơn tức giận
examples: Does your dog show aggression towards any strangers or just towards men?
You have to learn to control your aggression in order to avoid serious conflict.

definition:
angry, and behaving in a threatening way; ready to attack
    Hay tấn công, gây sự, gây gỗ, gây hấn, hung hăng, hùng hổ
examples: Men tend to be more aggressive than women.
If I criticize him, he gets aggressive and starts shouting.

definition:
the science or practice of farming
    Nông nghiệp
examples: The number of people employed in agriculture has fallen in the last decade.
50% of the country’s population depends on agriculture.

definition:
with plenty of fresh air because there is a lot of space
    Thoáng khí, thông khí, thoáng gió, lộng gió.
examples: The office was light and airy.
Dry the seeds in a cool, airy place.

definition:
causing worry and fear
    đáng báo động, đáng lo ngại
examples: alarming news
Beijing air pollution soars to alarming levels

definition:
drinks such as beer, wine, etc
    that can make people drunk
    rượu, bia, đồ uống có cồn
examples: I could smell the alcohol on his breath

definition:
very simple plants, such as seaweed, that have no real leaves, stems or roots, and that grow in or near water
    (Thực vật học) Tảo

difficulty digesting certain foods and having an unpleasant physical reaction to them
    dị ứng thức ăn
examples: an allergy to wheat
a wheat allergy

definition:
with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again
    Xen kẽ, xen nhau, luân phiên nhau, thay phiên.
examples: a dessert with alternate layers of fruit and cream
Stretch up 30 times with alternate arms as a warm-up exercise.

definition:
a thing that you can choose to do or have out of two or more possibilities
    Sự lựa chon (một trong hai).
    Con đường, chước cách.
examples: We can agree to their terms or else pull out of the deal completely: those are the two alternatives.
We had no alternative but to fire Gibson.
There is a vegetarian alternative on the menu every day.

definition:
fuel that can be used instead of fossil fuels such as coal and oil, and instead of nuclear fuel
    những nguồn “nhiên liệu xanh” để thay thế cho xăng dầu có nguồn gốc từ hoá thạch

(used to emphasize something) completely; in every way
    Hoàn toàn, hầu, hẳn
    Nhìn chung, nói chung; nhìn toàn bộ.
    Cả thảy, tất cả.
examples: The train went slower and slower until it stopped altogether.
It was an altogether different situation.
I’m not altogether convinced, I’m afraid.

definition: tham vọng, đặt ra kỳ vọng cao
examples: the government’s ambitious plans for social reform
Jogging every morning? That’s very ambitious, isn’t it?

definition:
to change a law, document, statement, etc
    slightly in order to correct a mistake or to improve it
    Sửa đổi, thay đổi (văn kiện pháp lý); bổ sung (chỗ thiếu sót, sai lầm trong một văn kiện
    )
examples: MPs were urged to amend the law to prevent another oil tanker disaster.
In line 20, "men" should be amended (= changed) to "people".

definition:
thinking that somebody/something is funny, so that you smile or laugh
    thấy buồn cười, thấy vui
examples: She was very amused by/at your comments.
Janet was not amused (= she was annoyed or angry).

definition:
(of a clock or watch) showing the time using hands on a dial and not with a display of numbers
    dùng cơ chế cơ học, không phải điện tử (VD đồng hồ cơ)
examples: analogue watch

definition:
the structure of an animal or a plant
    cấu trúc giải phẫu cơ thể
examples: the anatomy of the horse
human anatomy

definition:
of or from a long time ago, having lasted for a very long time
    Xưa, cổ
examples: the ancient kingdoms of Mexico
People have lived in this valley since ancient times.

definition:
containing or using a substance, for example penicillin, that can destroy or prevent the growth of bacteria and cure infections
    Thuốc kháng sinh
examples: I'm taking antibiotics for a throat infection
Some types of antibiotic are used to promote growth in farm animals.

definition:
in preparation for something happening
    sự chuẩn bị trước, sự tiên liệu trước
examples: She bought extra food in anticipation of more people coming than she'd invited

definition:
the state of feeling nervous or worried that something bad is going to happen
    Mối lo, mối lo âu, mối băn khoăn; sự lo lắng.
examples: Waiting for exam results is a time of great anxiety

definition:
feeling worried or nervous
    Áy náy, lo âu, lo lắng, băn khoăn
examples: He seemed anxious about the meeting
Parents are naturally anxious for their children.

definition:
a system of organs in the body
    (Sinh vật học) Bộ máy.
examples: the sensory apparatus

definition:
clothing, when it is being sold in shops/stores
    Quần áo, y phục
examples: The store sells women's and children's apparel

definition:
easy to see or understand
    [synonym] obvious
    rõ ràng, bày tỏ ra ngoài, thấy rõ ra ngoài
    Rõ rành rành, hiển nhiên, không thể chối cãi được.
examples: It was apparent from her face that she was really upset
It soon became apparent to everyone that he couldn't sing.

definition: to attract or interest somebody
examples: It's a programme designed to appeal mainly to 16 to 25-year-olds.
I think what appeals to me about his painting is his use of colour.

definition:
attractive or interesting
    Lôi cuốn, quyến rũ
examples: The idea of not having to get up early every morning is rather appealing (to me).
Brightly coloured packaging made the pens especially appealing to children
opposite unappealing

definition:
the feeling that you want to eat food
    cảm giác thèm ăn
examples: The walk gave me a good appetite.
Don't spoil your appetite by eating between meals.
He suffered from headaches and loss of appetite.

definition:
a device, machine, or piece of equipment, especially an electrical one that is used in the house, such as a cooker or washing machine
    Đồ thiết bị, trang thiết bị, dụng cụ
examples: electrical/household appliances
They sell a wide range of domestic appliances—washing machines, dishwashers and so on.

definition:
the act of examining someone or something in order to judge their qualities, success, or needs
    Sự đánh giá; sự định giá
examples: He had read many detailed critical appraisals of her work.
She was honest in her appraisal of her team's chances.

definition:
to recognize how good someone or something is and to value him, her, or it
    Biết thưởng thức, biết đánh giá
    Đánh giá đúng, đánh giá cao, hiểu rõ giá trị.
examples: His talents are not fully appreciated in that company
There's no point buying him expensive wines - he doesn't appreciate them.

definition:
the act of recognizing or understanding that something is valuable, important, or as described
    Sự đánh giá đúng, sự đánh giá cao, sự hiểu rõ giá trị.
    Sự biết thưởng thức, sự biết đánh giá.
examples: She shows little appreciation of good music.
Children rarely show any appreciation of/for what their parents do for them
These flowers are a token of my appreciation of/for all your help.

definition:
a way of dealing with somebody/something
    a way of doing or thinking about something such as a problem or a task
    Cách tiếp cận, phương pháp giải quyết (một vấn đề)
examples: She took the wrong approach in her dealings with them.
The school has decided to adopt a different approach to discipline.

definition:
suitable, acceptable or correct for the particular circumstances
    Thích hợp, thích đáng.
examples: Jeans are not appropriate for a formal party.
Now that the problem has been identified, appropriate action can be taken.
Is now an appropriate time to make a speech?

definition:
suitable or right for a particular situation
    Thích hợp, đúng, phù hợp
    Chuẩn không cần chỉnh
examples: a particularly apt description/name/comment

definition:
connected with water
    Sống ở nước, mọc ở nước.
    (Thể dục,thể thao) Chơi ở dưới nước (ví dụ bóng nước
    ).
examples: aquatic sports
aquatic plants/life/ecosystems

definition:
involving or relating to archeology
    liên quan đến khảo cổ học
examples: archeological excavations/evidence

definition:
someone who studies the buildings, graves, tools, and other objects of people who lived in the past
    Nhà khảo cổ.
examples: The site of the temple was discovered by a group of amateur archaeologists

definition:
the study of the buildings, graves, tools, and other objects that belonged to people who lived in the past, in order to learn about their culture and society
    Khảo cổ học.
examples: Daniel is very interested in history and archaeology, and often visits historic sites

definition:
a person whose job is designing buildings
    Kiến trúc sư.
examples: The house was designed by architect Louis Kahn

definition:
connected with architecture
    liên quan đến kiến trúc
examples: architectural features
architectural drawings/plans

definition:
the art and study of designing buildings
    môn kiến trúc, kiểu kiến trúc
examples: to study architecture

definition:
the most important town or city of a country, usually where the central government operates from
    Thủ đô, thủ phủ.
examples: Australia's capital city is Canberra
Cairo is the capital of Egypt.

definition:
punishment by death
    án tử hình (=death penalty)
examples: Public opinion was in favour of bringing back capital punishment

definition:
a small container with medicine inside that you swallow
    (Dược học) Bao con nhộng
examples: The medicine can be taken in tablet or capsule form.

definition:
a chemical element that exists in its pure form as diamond or graphite, and is an important part of other substances such as coal and oil
    (Hoá học) Cacbon
examples: New legislation aims to reduce carbon emissions
Iron with a high carbon content

definition:
the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes
    Sự nghiệp (của một người)
examples: a career in politics
a teaching career
What made you decide on a career as a vet?
She has been concentrating on her career.

definition:
(a plant with) a small flower with a sweet smell, usually white, pink, or red in colour
    Hoa cẩm chướng.
examples: He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole

definition:
to make something by cutting into especially wood or stone, or to cut into the surface of stone, wood, etc
    Khắc, tạc, chạm, đục.
examples: This totem pole is carved from/out of a single tree trunk.
He carved her name on a tree.
Some of the tunnels in the cliff are natural, some were carved out (= cut into the rock) by soldiers for defensive purposes.

definition:
a shape or pattern cut into wood or stone or the skill of doing this
    Nghệ thuật khắc, nghệ thuật tạc, nghệ thuật chạm
examples: wooden/stone carvings

definition:
a piece of clothing that the original owner no longer wants to wear
    quần áo cũ bị bỏ đi, không dùng đến nữa
examples: She used to wear her sister’s cast-offs

definition:
[of work] not permanent; not done, or doing something regularly
    Không đều, thất thường, lúc có lúc không
examples: casual workers/labour — người lao công có việc làm thất thường, người lao công không có việc làm cố định

They are employed on a casual basis (= they do not have a permanent job with the company).

definition:
a sudden event that causes many people to suffer
    [synonym] disaster
    Tai ương, tai biến, thảm hoạ, tai hoạ lớn
examples: Early warnings of rising water levels prevented another major catastrophe
We've had a few catastrophes with the food for the party.

definition:
(of a natural event) causing a lot of damage and suffering
    [synonym] disastrous
    causing a lot of problems for people
    [synonym]disastrous
    có tínhthảm hoạ, vô cùng thê thảm
examples: a catastrophic earthquake/flood/wildfire
a catastrophic failure/collapse/defeat

definition:
to provide the things that a particular person or situation needs or wants
    phục vụ nhu cầu của ai hay cái gì
examples: The club caters for children between the ages of four and twelve

It is a resort that clearly caters for the well-off.

definition:
a very large, usually stone, building for Christian worship
    (Công giáo) Nhà thờ chính tòa; nhà thờ lớn

cows and bulls that are kept for their milk or meat
    Thú nuôi, gia súc
examples: The farmer grazes cattle on this land in the summer months
a herd of cattle

definition:
a vegetable with green leaves around a large hard white head of flowers
    (Thực vật học) Cải hoa, hoa lơ, súp lơ
examples: Do you like cauliflower?
two cauliflowers
She lay on her back staring up at the ceiling.
a large room with a high ceiling
The walls and ceiling were painted white.

definition:
a famous person
    Nhân vật có danh tiếng, người nổi danh
examples: TV celebrities

definition:
to remove the parts of a book, film/movie, etc
    that are considered to be offensive, immoral or a political threat
    (dạng chủ động) kiểm duyệt.
    (dạng bị động) bị kiểm duyệt cắt đi.
examples: The news reports had been heavily censored.
The book was heavily censored when first published.

definition:
the act of censoring books, films, etc
    Công tác kiểm duyệt.
examples: The government has imposed strict censorship on the press.
to take action against institutions practising censorship

definition:
firmly believing something; having no doubts
    Chắc, chắc chắn.
examples: I feel certain (that) you're doing the right thing

They are not only the world's biggest fast-food chain, but also the industry's trendsetter.

definition:
a type of soft white stone
    Đá phấn.
examples: the chalk cliffs of southern England

definition:
a new or difficult task that tests somebody’s ability and skill
    thách thức
examples: The role will be the biggest challenge of his acting career.
Schools must meet the challenge of new technology (= deal with it successfully).

definition:
difficult, in a way that tests your ability or determination
    có tính thử thách
examples: He resigned from the company in order to take a more challenging job.
She doesn't find the general knowledge crossword challenging enough.

definition:
qualities that are interesting and unusual
    nét đặc sắc
examples: a hotel of character

Old books are said to give a room character.
As people grow older, their faces acquire more character.

definition:
to love, protect, and care for someone or something that is important to you
    trân trọng, yêu thương
examples: Although I cherish my children, I do allow them their independence.
Her most cherished possession is a 1926 letter from F
Scott Fitzgerald.
Freedom of speech is a cherished (= carefully protected) right in this country.

definition:
to crush food into smaller, softer pieces with the teeth so that it can be swallowed
    Nhai
examples: This meat is difficult to chew.
You don't chew your food enough - that's why you get indigestion.

definition:
the period of somebody’s life when they are a child
    Tuổi thơ ấu, thời thơ ấu
examples: childhood, adolescence and adulthood
in early childhood
childhood memories/experiences

definition:
a structure through which smoke or steam is carried up away from a fire, etc

    Ống khói
examples: factory chimneys belching smoke over the town

definition:
to design and arrange the steps and movements for dancers in a ballet or a show
    Sáng tác và dàn dựng điệu múa
examples: (figurative) There was some carefully choreographed flag-waving as the President drove by

definition: (Y học) Mạn, mãn tính, kinh niên.
examples: a hospital for the chronically ill

definition:
in a way that arranges a number of events in the order in which they happened
    Theo niên đại, theo thứ tự thời gian.
examples: The works are arranged chronologically to reveal artistic development over 35 centuries

definition:
a small piece of ash or partly burnt coal, wood, etc
    that is no longer burning but may still be hot
    Thanh cháy dở.
    Xỉ, than xỉ.
examples: The logs had turned into blackened cinders.
a fireplace full of glowing red cinders

definition:
shaped like a circle; round
    Tròn, vòng, vòng quanh.
examples: a circular building

The crater was two miles across and roughly circular.

definition:
fruit belonging to the group of fruit that includes oranges, lemons, limes and grapefruit
    any of a group of plants that produce acidic fruits with a lot of juice
    (Thực vật học) Giống cam quít
examples: The field was planted with citrus trees.
Oranges, lemons, limes and grapefruit are types of citrus fruit.

definition:
the culture and way of life of a society or country at a particular period in time
    Nền văn minh
examples: We spent a week visiting the wonders of Ancient Greek civilization.
Historians still argue about what causes such a mighty civilization to collapse.

definition:
(formal) to make something clearer or easier to understand
    Làm rõ, làm cho dễ hiểu hơn
examples: Could you clarify the first point please? I don't understand it completely.
Talking to someone has helped clarify my feelings.

definition:
a form of music developed from a European tradition mainly in the 18th and 19th centuries
    nhạc cổ điển
examples: My wife likes classical music but I prefer jazz

definition:
one of the sharp curved nails at the end of each of the toes of some animals and birds
    Vuốt (mèo, chim).
    Chân có vuốt.
examples: Our cat likes to sharpen her claws on the legs of the dining table

definition:
to make something completely clean
    to make someone or something morally clean or pure
    làm trong sạch, làm cho tinh khiết
examples: The mayor has promised to cleanse the city of drug dealers (= to remove them from the city

definition:
clear or obvious without needing any proof
    Rõ ràng, dứt khoát.
examples: She has clear-cut evidence that her husband has cheated on her.

definition:
a person whose job is to keep the records or accounts in an office, shop/store etc
    Người thư ký
    (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Người giúp việc bán hàng, nhân viên bán hàng.
examples: an office clerk

definition:
a high area of rock with a very steep side, often on a coast
    Vách đá (nhô ra biển)
examples: We built a house at the foot of a cliff
Keep away from the edge of the cliff - you might fall.

definition:
the regular pattern of weather conditions of a particular place
    Khí hậu
examples: a mild/temperate/warm/wet climate
the harsh climate of the Arctic regions

definition:
changes in the earth’s weather, especially the increase in the temperature caused by the increase of particular gases, especially carbon dioxide
    biến đổi khí hậu
examples: the threat of global climate change

definition:
near in family relationship
    [opposite] distant
    Gần, thân, sát.
examples: close relatives, such as your mother and father, and brothers and sisters

definition:
(of a group of people) having strong relationships with each other and taking a close, friendly interest in each other’s activities and problems
    Gắn bó với nhau (về tình cảm, quyền lợi).

definition:
(a lot of objects in) a state of being untidy
    sự bừa bãi, lộn xộn

definition:
the land next to or close to the sea
    bờ biển
examples: a town on the south coast of England
islands off the west coast of Ireland

definition:
of or near a coast
    (thuộc) bờ biển; (thuộc) miền ven biển
examples: coastal waters/resorts/scenery
a coastal path (= one that follows the line of the coast)

definition:
the hair, wool, or fur covering an animal
    Bộ lông (thú)

animals in their winter coats (= grown long for extra warmth)

definition:
connected with thinking or conscious mental processes
    Liên quan đến nhận thức.

cognitive psychology

This is both a cognitive and an emotional process.

definition:
to fall down suddenly because of pressure or having no strength or support
    Đổ, sập, sụp, sụp đổ

definition:
a person that you work with, especially in a profession or a business
    Bạn đồng nghiệp, bạn đồng sự

definition:

    Va nhau, đụng nhau

definition:
an accident in which two vehicles or people crash into each other
    Sự đụng, sự va

Stewart was injured in a collision with another player.

definition:
to take control of an area or a country that is not your own, especially using force, and send people from your own country to live there
    Chiếm làm thuộc địa

definition:
a country or an area that is governed by people from another, more powerful, country
    Thuộc địa

definition:

    Đánh nhau, chiến đấu

definition:

definition:
a mass of ice and dust that moves around the sun and looks like a bright star with a tail
    Sao chổi

a person who is an expert on a particular subject and talks or writes about it on television or radio, or in a newspaper
    Nhà bình luận
examples: a political commentator

definition: (Thuộc) Buôn bán; (thuộc) thương mại; (thuộc) thương nghiệp

definition:
to do something wrong or illegal
    thực hiện hành vi phạm pháp

definition:
done very often, or existing in many places, and therefore not unusual
    bình thường, phổ biến, chẳng có gì là lạ

definition:
to exchange information, news, ideas, etc

definition:

definition:
smaller than is usual for things of the same kind
    Nhỏ gọn

6lb.
I enjoy Jo's company (= I enjoy being with her).
a pleasant evening in the company of friends.

definition:
to try to be more successful or better than somebody else who is trying to do the same as you
    đua tranh, ganh đua, cạnh tranh, tranh tài

definition:

    Thành phần, phần hợp thành

the composition of the board of directors

    Hiểu, lĩnh hội, nhận thức thấu đáo

definition:

definition:
that you can imagine or believe
    [synonym] possible

oppositeinconceivable

definition:

definition:

definition:
about something; involving somebody/something

examples: He asked several questions concerning the future of the company.

definition:

    Kết thúc, chấm dứt ((công việc
    ); bế mạc (phiên họp)

examples: She concluded the speech by reminding us of our responsibility.
Before I conclude, I'd like to thank you all for coming.

definition:

definition:

    Chỉ trích, chê trách, lên án, quy tội

definition:

    (Vật lý) Dẫn

to conduct heat — dẫn nhiệt

definition:

    (Vật lý) Chất dẫn (điện, nhiệt)

metals are good conductors — kim loại là những chất dẫn tốt

    Hội nghị

    Sự liên quan, sự liên lạc, mối quan hệ; sự chấp nối.

definition:

to make a conscious decision

a conscious act of cruelty
opposite unconscious

definition:

definition:
to agree to do something, or to allow someone to do something

examples: Very reluctantly, I've consented to lend her my car.

definition:
a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient
    Hậu quả, kết quả.
examples: This decision could have serious consequences for the industry.

to suffer/face/take the consequences of your actions

definition:

    Do đó, vì vậy cho nên, bởi thế; vậy thì.

definition:
[only before noun] related to or happening in the regions around the North Pole

examples: Arctic explorers

definition:
used when you are stating an opinion that you believe you could give reasons to support
    Có thể nói rằng (dùng trước khi nói một câu mình nghĩ mình có bằng chứng cho nó)

definition:

    Khô cằn (đất).

definition:
a weapon that is like a long, thin stick with a sharp point at one end and often feathers at the other, shot from a bow
    Tên, mũi tên
examples: Robin Hood asked to be buried where his arrow landed
a bow and arrowto fire/shoot an arrowThe road continues as straight as an arrow.
A cinema was burned out in north London last night
Police suspect arson

definition:
an object that is made by a person, especially something of historical or cultural interest
    (Khảo cổ học) Đồ tạo tác
examples: The museum's collection includes artefacts dating back to prehistoric times

definition:

    Động mạch, mạch máu

definition:
a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine
    Bài báo
examples: Have you seen that article about young fashion designers?

definition:
made by people, not real
    giả tạo; giả

definition:
a person who creates works of art, especially paintings or drawings
    Hoạ sĩ
    Nghệ sĩ.
examples: Monet is one of my favourite artists
an exhibition of work by contemporary British artists

definition:
relating to art

    (Thuộc) Nghệ thuật; (thuộc) mỹ thuật.

definition:

    Biết chắc; xác định; tìm hiểu chắc chắn.

definition:

    đánh giá; ước định

Exams are not the only means of assessing a student's ability.

definition:
a useful or valuable quality, skill, or person
    (Thông tục) Vốn quý, thứ có ích, vật quý.
examples: Being able to speak a foreign language is a major asset

definition:
a piece of work given to someone, typically as part of their studies or job
    công việc hoặc bài tập được giao cho ai đó
examples: I have a lot of reading assignments to complete before the end of term

definition:
to connect someone or something in your mind with someone or something else
    kết nối, có liên quan với
examples: I always associate the smell of baking with my childhood

definition:
a connection or relationship between people or organizations
    Sự kết hợp, sự liên hợp
    Mối liên quan (giữa A và B)
examples: The cats soon made the association (= made the connection)between human beings and food

definition:
one of many large rocks that circle the sun
    (Thiên văn học) Tiểu hành tinh, hành tinh nhỏ

so surprising that it is difficult to believe
    [synonym] astonishing
    Làm kinh ngạc, làm kinh hoàng.
    Làm sững sờ, làm sửng sốt.
examples: There was an astounding 20% increase in sales.

definition:

    Phi hành gia, nhà du hành vũ trụ.
examples: sending astronauts into space

definition:
connected with astronomy
    (thuộc) Thiên văn, (thuộc) thiên văn học.
examples: the Royal Astronomical Society
astronomical observations/instruments

definition:

    bầu khí quyển

definition:
related to the earth’s atmosphere
    (Thuộc) bầu khí quyển, (thuộc) không khí
examples: Plants are the main source of atmospheric oxygen.

definition:
to succeed in getting something, usually after a lot of effort
    Đến tới, đạt tới
examples: Most of our students attained five ‘A’ grades in their exams.

pronunciationString: attention-grabbing
definition: cố tình thu hút sự chú ý
examples: an attention-grabbing marketing campaign.

definition:
an interesting or enjoyable place to go or thing to do
    điểm thu hút khách du lịch, thắng cảnh
examples: Buckingham Palace is a major tourist attraction

definition:
the group of people together in one place to watch or listen to a play, film, someone speaking, etc
    Những người nghe, thính giả; người xem, khán giả; bạn đọc, độc giả
examples: She lectures to audiences all over the world.
The secret to public speaking is to get the audience on your side.

definition:
the people or an organization who have the power to make decisions or who have a particular area of responsibility in a country or region
    nhà cầm quyền, nhà chức trách, nhà đương cục
examples: The health authorities are investigating the problem.
I have to report this to the authorities.
the immigration authorities

definition:
to use machines and computers instead of people to do a job or task
    Tự động hoá
examples: The entire manufacturing process has been automated.
The factory is now fully automated.
automatic doors
a fully automatic driverless train

definition:
without needing a person to operate controls
    một cách tự động
examples: The heating switches off automatically.
The clock automatically readjusts when you enter a new time zone.

definition:
the use of machines to do work that was previously done by people
    Sự tự động hoá; kỹ thuật tự động
examples: Automation meant the loss of many factory jobs.

pronunciationString: a walk of life
definition: a person's job or position in society
examples: She has friends from all walks of life

definition:
having an amount of something that is very large or larger than necessary or wanted
    tràn ngập, nhiều không kể xiết
examples: The computer market is awash with software for every kind of computer.
The village is awash with history, legends and local charm.

pronunciationString: a way of life
definition:
1
    a typical way in which a person or group lives.
    2
examples: the rural way of life
Shortages have become a way of life here.

definition:
feelings of respect and slight fear; feelings of being very impressed by something/somebody
    sự kính trọng, sự ngưỡng mộ, sự choáng ngợp (xen lẫn chút sợ hãi)
examples: I've always held musicians in awe.
As children we were rather in awe of our grandfather.
You can't help but stand in awe of (= respect greatly and fear slightly) powerful people.

definition:
difficult to use, do, or deal with
    Khó xử, rầy rà, rắc rối
examples: Some of the questions were rather awkward
My car's quite awkward to drive.

definition:
to take care of babies or children for a short time while their parents are out
    Giữ trẻ hộ (trong khi bố mẹ đi vắng); trông nom trẻ em.
examples: She regularly babysits for us.
He's babysitting the neighbour's children.

definition:
to cook food in an oven without extra fat or liquid; to be cooked in this way
    Bỏ lò, nướng bằng lò
examples: I'm baking a birthday cake for Alex.
the delicious smell of baking bread

definition:
an area with a wall or bars around it that is joined to the outside wall of a building on an upper level
    Ban công
examples: We had a drink on the hotel balcony.

definition:
a female ballet dancer
    Nữ diễn viên ba lê

a type of dancing where carefully organized movements tell a story or express an idea
    [countable] a story or work of art performed by a group of ballet dancers
    Ba lê
    Vở ba lê
examples: a ballet dancer
By the age of 15 he had already composed his first ballet (= music for a ballet).
‘Swan Lake’ is one of the great classical ballets.

definition:
in a way that is just possible but only with difficulty
    in a way that almost does not happen or exist
    vừa mới, vừa đủ
    gần như không có
examples: He could barely read and write.
The music was barely audible.
She barely acknowledged his presence
There was barely any smell.

definition:
(of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it
    (đất) cằn cỗi, khô cằn
examples: a barren desert
a barren landscape (= one that is empty, with few plants)

definition:
a line of objects placed across a road, etc
    to stop people from getting past
    Vật chướng ngại (để chặn, phòng thủ)
examples: Students built a barricade against the police
The protesters formed a human barricade.

definition:
an object like a fence that prevents people from moving forward from one place to another
    rào cản, chướng ngại vật
examples: The crowd had to stand behind barriers
The mountains acted as a natural barrier to the spread of the disease.

definition:
the simplest and most important facts, ideas, or things connected with something
    (những thứ cơ bản nhất)
examples: I really must learn the the basics of first aid.
This range of books for young children covers basics like the alphabet and numbers.

definition:
the reason why people take a particular action
    trên cơ sở, vì lý do
examples: She was chosen for the job on the basis of her qualifications.
Some movies have been banned on the basis that they are too violent

definition:
the hard, pointed part of a bird's mouth
    Mỏ (chim)
examples: Birds use their beaks to pick up food

definition:
as the representative of somebody or instead of them
    thay mặt cho, nhân danh
examples: On behalf of the department I would like to thank you all.
Mr Knight cannot be here, so his wife will accept the prize on his behalf.

definition:
to do things in a particular way
    [synonym] act
    Ăn ở, đối xử, cư xử
examples: he doctor behaved very unprofessionally.
They behaved very badly towards their guests.
He behaved like a true gentleman.
She behaved with great dignity.

definition:
to see or look at someone or something
    Nhìn ngắm, chiêm ngưỡng
    Thấy, trông thấy.
examples: The new bridge is an incredible sight to behold
Her face was a joy to behold
They beheld a bright star shining in the sky.

definition:
a person who sees or observes someone or something
    Người xem, người ngắm; khán giả.
    người chứng kiến, người được mục kích.
examples: the building and landscape can elicit imaginative responses from the beholder

definition:
helpful, useful, or good
    Có ích; có lợi; tốt.
examples: A good diet is beneficial to health

definition:
a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgement
    (Nghĩa bóng) Khuynh hướng, sự thiên về; thành kiến, thiên vị
examples: accusations of political bias in news programmes (= that reports are unfair and show favour to one political party)
Employers must consider all candidates impartially and without bias.
Some institutions still have a strong bias against women.

definition:
having a tendency to show favour towards or against one group of people or one opinion for personal reasons; making unfair judgements
    Có khuynh hướng, thiên về một phía; cóthành kiến, thiên vị
examples: The newspapers gave a very biased report of the meeting.
I think she's beautiful but then I'm biased since she's my daughter.

definition:
the existence of a large number of different kinds of animals and plants which make a balanced environment
    Tính đa dạng sinh học
examples: The mining project threatens one of the world’s richest areas of biodiversity.

definition:
fuel made from plant or animal sources and used in engines
    nhiên liệu sinh học
examples: biofuels made from sugar cane and sugar beet
energy from biofuel sources

definition:
connected with the natural processes of living things
    (Thuộc) Sinh học.
examples: the biological sciences
Eating is a biological necessity!

definition:
a scientist who studies biology
    Nhà nghiên cứu về sinh vật học.
examples: She’s a research biologist for a pharmaceutical company

definition:
the scientific study of the natural processes of living things
    Sinh vật học.
examples: She studied biology at university

definition:
not having a strong taste or character or not showing any interest or energy
    nhạt nhẽo, vô vị
examples: I find chicken a little bland.
Pop music these days is so bland.

definition:
to mix or combine together
    Trộn lẫn, pha trộn
examples: Blend the ingredients into a smooth paste.
The carpet blends well with the colour of the walls.

definition:
an electric machine used in the kitchen for breaking down foods or making smooth liquid substances from soft foods and liquids
    máy xay sinh tố
examples: Combine the milk and eggs in a blender

definition:
to make the difference between two things less clear, or to make it difficult to see the exact truth about something
    Làm mờ đi, che mờ
examples: This film blurs the line between reality and fantasy
The line between make-believe and reality became increasingly blurred.
She tends to blur the distinction between her friends and her colleagues.

definition:
a close connection joining two or more people
    (Nghĩa bóng) mối quan hệ, mối ràng buộc.
examples: A bond of friendship had been forged between them
The agreement strengthened the bonds between the two countries
the special bond between mother and child

definition:
a large fire that is made outside to burn unwanted things, or for pleasure
    lửa trại

a real or imagined line that marks the edge or limit of something
    Đường biên giới, ranh giới.
examples: The Ural mountains mark the boundary between Europe and Asia.
Residents are opposed to the prison being built within the city boundary.

definition:
a weapon used for shooting arrows, consisting of a long, curved piece of wood with a tight string joining its ends
    Cái cung
examples: To draw (bend) the bow — giương cung
She braided the horse's tail.
a braided leather bracelet/belt

definition:
one of the parts of a tree that grows out from the main trunk and has leaves, flowers, or fruit on it
    Cành cây
examples: She climbed the tree and hid in the branches
The fruit on the lower branches was protected from the sun.

definition:
a type of product made by a particular company
    Nhãn (hàng hoá), thương hiệu
examples: Which brand of toothpaste do you use?
This isn't my usual brand of deodorant.

pronunciationString: break down
definition:
to fail,to become very bad
    [(đồ vật)] hỏng, vỡ vụn
    [(sự việc, mối quan hệ)] thất bại, sụp đổ, rạn nứt
examples: Negotiations between the two sides have broken down
Her health broke down under the pressure of work.

definition:
to take air into your lungs and send it out again through your nose or mouth
    Hít, thở
examples: He breathed deeply before speaking again.
The air was so cold we could hardly breathe.

definition:
extremely exciting, beautiful, or surprising
    hấp dẫn, ngoạn mục
examples: The view from the top of the mountain is breathtaking.

definition:
a rectangular block of hard material used for building walls and houses
    Gạch
examples: The chimney was made of bricks.
red-brick houses

definition:
full of light; shining strongly
    Sáng, sáng chói
    Sáng sủa; rạng rỡ, sáng ngời; rực rỡ.
examples: The rooms were bright and airy.
The lights are too bright in here - they're hurting my eyes.
A bright star was shining in the East.

definition:
(of light or colours) very bright
    Sáng chói, chói loà; rực rỡ.
examples: brilliant sunshine
brilliant blue eyes

definition: quickly
examples: She walked briskly over to the phone and answered it.
The game is selling briskly.

definition:
a short stiff hair
    Lông cứng
examples: hog's bristles — lông lợn

definition:
including a great variety of people or things
    rộng, đa dạng (nghĩa bóng)
examples: a broad range of products
a broad and balanced curriculum
The magazine covers a broad range of subjects, from sewing to psychology.
Radio Caroline used to broadcast from a boat in the North Sea.
The tennis championship is broadcast live to several different countries.
figurative I'm leaving but please don't broadcast (= tell everyone) the fact.

definition:
someone whose job is to speak on radio or television programmes
    a company that sends out television or radio programmes
    Người nói chuyện trên đài phát thanh, người hát trên đài phát thanh
    công ty truyền thông, hãng truyền thông
examples: He was a famous broadcaster in the 1930s
the new Australian rugby broadcaster, Channel Ten

definition:
a vegetable with a thick green stem and several dark green or purple flower heads
    Cây bông cải xanh

a plan to show how much money a person or organization will earn and how much they will need or be able to spend
    Ngân sách, ngân quỹ
examples: We decorated the house on a tight budget (= without much money to spend)
The work was finished on time and within budget (= did not cost more money than was planned)
They went over budget (= spent too much money).
a computer workstation with a built-in telephone, answering machine and fax
All the rooms have built-in cupboards/wardrobes.

definition:
(of a thing) large and difficult to move or carry
    To lớn, đồ sộ; kềnh càng
examples: Bulky items will be collected separately.
The key felt bulky in his pocket.

definition:
a duty, responsibility, etc
    that causes worry, difficulty or hard work
    Gánh nặng ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng))
examples: o bear/carry/ease/reduce/share the burden
Buying a house often places a large financial burden on young couples.
I don't want to become a burden to my children when I'm old.

definition:
developing quickly
    phát triển rất là nhanh
examples: The company hoped to profit from the burgeoning communications industry
a burgeoning populationburgeoning demand

definition:
a person who enters a building illegally in order to steal
    Kẻ trộm đêm; kẻ trộm bẻ khoá, kẻ trộm đào ngạch.
examples: Burglars broke into the gallery and stole dozens of priceless paintings
It was brave of you to chase after the burglar
No household security devices will protect you against the determined burglar.

definition:
the crime of entering a building illegally and stealing things from it
    [synonym] housebreaking
    Ăn trộm đêm; ăn trộm bẻ khoá, ăn trộm đào ngạch.
examples: Several men were questioned by police yesterday about the burglary.
Simpson, aged 19, was convicted on two charges of burglary.
The latest crime figures show a sharp rise in burglaries.

definition:
a hole in the ground dug by an animal such as a rabbit, especially to live in
    Hang (cầy, thỏ, chuột)

examples: I hate it when balloons burst.
Suddenly the door burst open (= opened suddenly and forcefully) and police officers rushed in.

definition:
a system of broadcasting television programmes along wires rather than by radio waves
    truyền hình cáp
examples: He works for a cable television company.
The office has gone over to cable.
This channel is only available on cable

definition:
a small electronic device or piece of software for calculating with numbers
    Máy tính
examples: a pocket calculator
Exam candidates are not allowed to use advanced calculators with database capability.

definition:
a table showing all the days, weeks, and months of the year
    Lịch (ghi năm tháng)
examples: An old calendar for 2012 was still hanging on the wall of her office

definition:
(of the sea) without large waves
    lặng, không nổi sóng (biển)
    (of the weather) without windêm đềm, lặng gió (thời tiết)
examples: a calm, cloudless day

definition:
a long straight passage dug in the ground and filled with water for boats and ships to travel along
    a smaller passage used for carrying water to fields, crops, etc.
    Kênh, sông đào
examples: The Panama Canal provides a crucial shipping link between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans
In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.

definition:
a person who is trying to be elected or is applying for a job
    Người ứng cử.
    Người dự thi; thí sinh.
    Người dự tuyển (vào một chức gì).
examples: There are three candidates standing in the election
There were a large number of candidates for the job.

definition:
to use as little of something as possible so that it lasts a long time
    Giữ gìn, duy trì, bảo tồn, bảo toàn
examples: Help to conserve energy by insulating your home.
Renewable energy resources can help conserve fossil fuels and reduce carbon emissions.

definition:
much; a lot
    [synonym] significantly
    một cách đáng kể, lớn lao, nhiều
examples: The need for sleep varies considerably from person to person.
Interest rates on bank loans have increased considerably in recent years.

definition:
to make something stronger so that it is more likely to continue
    Làm (cho) vững chắc thêm, củng cố
examples: With this new movie he has consolidated his position as the country's leading director.
Italy consolidated their lead with a second goal.

definition:
happening a lot or all the time
    không ngớt, không dứt, liên miên, liên tiếp
examples: I have to combat this constant desire to eat chocolate.

definition:
all the time; repeatedly
    Luôn luôn, liên miên
examples: Fashion is constantly changing.
Heat the sauce, stirring constantly.
We are constantly on the lookout for new ideas.
to construct a new bridge/building
The walls are constructed of concrete.

definition:
the work of building or making something, especially buildings, bridges, etc
    a building
    Sự xây dựng
    tòa nhà
examples: She works in construction/in the construction industry.
The bridge is a marvellous work of engineering and construction.
What's that concrete and metal construction over there?

definition:
an area of land where something is being built
    công trường xây dựng

a person who knows a lot about a particular subject and is employed to give advice about it to other people
    Nhà chuyên môn; chuyên viên, cố vấn; người cho ý kiến; người được hỏi ý kiến
examples: a firm of management consultants
the President’s consultant on economic affairs

definition:
to use something, especially fuel, energy or time
    Dùng, tiêu thụ
examples: The electricity industry consumes large amounts of fossil fuels.
25 per cent of the world’s population consumes 80 per cent of the planet’s resources.
Agricultural companies have failed to convince consumers that GM foods are safe.
What the problem comes down to is 'Will the consumer be willing to pay more for a higher quality product?'

definition:
the buying and using of goods and services; the belief that it is good for a society or an individual person to buy and use a large quantity of goods and services
    Chủ nghĩa tiêu thụ, sự tiêu dùng

to communicate with somebody, for example by telephone or letter
    liên lạc
examples: I've been trying to contact you all day.
Witnesses to the accident are asked to contact the police.

definition:
to have something inside or include something as a part:
    Chứa đựng, bao hàm, gồm có, bao gồm
examples: How much liquid do you think this bottle contains?
I lost a file containing a lot of important documents.
Try to avoid foods which contain a lot of fat.

definition:
a large metal or wooden box of a standard size in which goods are packed so that they can easily be lifted onto a ship, train, etc
    to be transported
    Côngtenơ
examples: a container ship (= one designed to transport such containers)

definition:
to make a substance or place dirty or no longer pure by adding a substance that is dangerous or carries disease
    Làm bẩn, làm ô uế.
    Làm nhiễm (bệnh).
examples: The drinking water has become contaminated with lead.
a river contaminated by pollution

definition:
the process or fact of making a substance or place dirty or no longer pure by adding a substance that is dangerous or carries disease
    Sự làm bẩn, sự làm ô uế; cái làm ô uế
examples: radioactive contamination
Environmental contamination resulting from human activities is a major health concern.

definition:
to think about whether you should do something, or how you should do something
    [synonym] consider, think about/of
    Dự tính, trù tính, cân nhắc (có nên làm một việc gì đó hay không)
examples: You're too young to be contemplating retirement
I have never contemplated living abroad.
I'm contemplating going abroad for a year
They were contemplating a move to California.

definition:
to say that something is true, especially in an argument
    [synonym] maintain
    Dám chắc rằng, cho rằng
examples: I would contend that the minister's thinking is flawed on this point
The lawyer contended (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.

definition:
the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it
    Khung cảnh, phạm vi, bối cảnh
    (Văn học) Văn cảnh, ngữ cảnh, mạch văn.
examples: This speech needs to be set in the context of Britain in the 1960s.
His decision can only be understood in context.
What was the context you found the word in?

definition:
happening repeatedly, usually in an annoying or not convenient way
    Liên tục, liên miên
examples: I've had continual problems with this car ever since I bought it.
I'm sorry - I can't work with these continual interruptions.

definition:
to say that something that somebody else has said is wrong, and that the opposite is true
    (of statements or pieces of evidence) to be so different from each other that one of them must be wrong
    Cãi lại, phủ nhận
    Mâu thuẫn với, trái với.
examples: All evening her husband contradicted everything she said
The two stories contradict each other.

definition:
a machine or piece of equipment that looks strange
    một cái máy, một cái thiết bị trông kỳ cục
examples: She showed us a strange contraption that looked like a satellite dish
What's that strange contraption in the garage?

definition:
an action or a service that helps to cause or increase something
    Sự đóng góp, sự góp phần; phần đóng góp, phần gánh vác
examples: He made a very positive contribution to the success of the project.
a significant contribution to scientific knowledge
the car’s contribution to the greenhouse effect
a controversial plan to build a new road

definition:
public discussion and argument about something that many people strongly disagree about, disapprove of, or are shocked by
    Sự tranh luận, sự tranh cãi
    Cuộc tranh luận, cuộc bàn cãi, cuộc luận chiến; cuộc bút chiến.
examples: There was a big controversy surrounding/over the use of drugs in athletics
The policy has caused fierce/heated controversy ever since it was introduced.

definition:
(a) talk between two or more people
    sự nói chuyện; cuộc nói chuyện, cuộc chuyện trò, cuộc đàm luận
examples: She had a strange conversation with the man who moved in upstairs.
It's impossible to hold a conversation with all this noise going on!

definition:
(formal) to have a conversation with somebody
    nói chuyện, chuyện trò
examples: She conversed with the Romanians in French.
The two men were conversing on music and opera.

definition:
to decide and state officially in court that somebody is guilty of a crime
    Kết án, tuyên bố có tội
examples: a convicted murderer
He was convicted of fraud.
There wasn’t enough evidence to convict her.
opposite acquit

definition:
to make somebody/yourself believe that something is true
    Làm cho tin, làm cho nghe theo, thuyết phục
examples: You'll need to convince them of your enthusiasm for the job
The experience convinced him that Europe was on the brink of a revolution.

definition:
to deal successfully with a difficult situation
    (+ with) Đối phó, đương đầu.
examples: It must be really hard to cope with three young children and a job
multinational corporations
the Sony corporation

definition:
if two or more facts, figures, etc
    Có tương quan với nhau
examples: A high-fat diet correlates with a greater risk of heart disease.
The average speed of the vehicles correlates closely with the severity of the accident caused.

definition:
(with somebody) (formal) to write letters to somebody and receive letters/emails from them
    Giao thiệp bằng thư từ, trao đổi thư từ
examples: She corresponded regularly with her former teacher
I've been corresponding with several experts in the field.

definition:
a substance that you put on your face or body to make it more attractive
    mỹ phẩm
examples: We sell a wide range of cosmetics and toiletries at a very reasonable price.
We’re introducing a new line of cosmetics

definition:
relating to the universe and the natural processes that happen in it
    (Thuộc) Vũ trụ
examples: cosmic dust/radiation

definition: đa văn hóa, đa chủng tộc, đa quốc gia
examples: New York is a highly cosmopolitan city.
Jamaica is a very cosmopolitan island.

definition:
the universe, especially when it is thought of as an ordered system
    Vũ trụ.
    Sự trật tự, sự hài hoà.
examples: the structure of the cosmos
our place in the cosmos

definition:
comfortable and pleasant, especially (of a building) because of being small and warm
    Ấm cúng, thoải mái dễ chịu
examples: This room is nice and cosy in the winter.
He showed me into a cosy little room.

definition:
a small house, especially in the country
    Nhà tranh.
    Nhà riêng ở nông thôn.
examples: a charming country cottage with roses around the door
They live in an idyllic country/thatched cottage, with roses around the door.

definition:
to react to something with an opposing opinion or action, or to defend yourself against something
    Chặn lại và đánh trả, phản công lại (đấu kiếm, quyền Anh).
examples: After the government bombed their camp, the rebels countered with an attack on the capital.
When criticisms were made of the school's performance, the parents' group countered with details of its exam results.
Extra police have been moved into the area to counter the risk of violence.

definition:
to reduce or remove the effect of something unwanted by producing an opposite effect
    Chống lại, kháng cự lại.
examples: These exercises aim to counteract the effects of stress and tension

definition:
land outside towns and cities, with fields, woods, etc.
    nông thôn, miền quê, vùng quê, địa phương (ở nông thôn)
examples: The countryside around there is beautiful.
Every summer thousands of people flock to the countryside.

definition:
an activity involving a special skill at making things with your hands
    Nghề, nghề thủ công.
examples: traditional crafts like basket-weaving
a craft fair/workshop

definition:
a skilled person, especially one who makes beautiful things by hand
    Thợ thủ công.
    Người khéo léo, người có kỹ xảo, người điêu luyện, người lành nghề.
examples: The plates are painted by our finest craftsmen
rugs handmade by local craftsmenIt is clearly the work of a master craftsman.

definition:
not having enough space or time
    Chật hẹp, tù túng, không được tự do
examples: a cramped room/house
We have six desks in this room, so we're a little cramped (for space).
I have a very cramped schedule.

definition:
the round hole at the top of a volcano, or a hole in the ground similar to this
    Miệng núi lửa.
    Hố (bom, đạn đại bác
    ).

definition:

pronunciationString: give way to
definition:

definition:

    liên quan đến trọng lực, lực hấp dẫn

definition:
(of cows, sheep, etc
    ) to eat grass that is growing in a field
    to (cause animals to) eat grass

definition:

definition:

definition:

perfect, or the best possible

definition:

definition:

definition:

definition:

definition:

    )

definition:

definition:

definition:

definition:

definition:

definition:

    )

definition:

    ); bắt chịu, bắt gánh vác, bắt cáng đáng

definition:

pronunciationString: /ɪnˌves. tɪ. ɡə. t̬ɪv ˈdʒɝː. nə. lɪ. zəm/
