definition:
a reason for doing something
    Cớ, lý do, động cơ (của một hành động)
examples: Why would she have killed him? She has no motive.
Does he have a motive for lying about where he was?
What is the motive behind (= the reason for) the bombing?
I think you should examine/question their motives in offering to lend you the money.

definition:
to gradually increase, rise, or get bigger
    Tăng lên
examples: The children's excitement is mounting as Christmas gets nearer
Pressure is mounting on the government to change the law.

definition:
(of an area) having a lot of mountains
    (khu vực) nhiều đồi núi
examples: a mountainous region

definition:
for or including people of several different races, religions, languages and traditions
    đa văn hoá khác nhau
examples: We live in a multicultural society.
a multicultural approach to education

definition:
the belief that different cultures within a society should all be given importance
    sự đa văn hoá, sự khuyến khích đa văn hoá

(of a business) producing and selling goods in several different countries
    (Công ty) đa quốc gia (kinh doanh ở nhiều nước khác nhau)
examples: a major multinational food company

definition:
very ordinary and therefore not interesting
    tầm thường, bình thường, không có gì đặc sắc
examples: Mundane matters such as paying bills and shopping for food do not interest her
On a more mundane level, can we talk about the timetable for next week?

definition:
the crime of killing somebody deliberately
    [synonym] homicide
    Tội giết người, tội ám sát
examples: He was found guilty of murder.
She has been charged with the attempted murder of her husband.
to commit (a) murder

definition:
a person who has killed somebody deliberately and illegally
    [synonym] killer
    Kẻ giết người
examples: a convicted murderer
a mass murderer (= who has killed a lot of people)

definition:
one of many tissues in the body that can tighten and relax to produce movement
    Cơ bắp
    (Nghĩa bóng) Sức lực.
examples: This exercise will work the muscles of the lower back.
She tried to relax her tense muscles.

definition:
someone who is skilled in playing music, usually as a job
    nhạc công
examples: The concert features dancers and musicians of all nationalities
The famous jazz musician, Duke Ellington, was a composer, arranger and pianist.

definition:
something that many people believe but that does not exist or is false
    [synonym] fallacy
    một điều được tin rộng rãi, nhưng không có cơ sở khoa học
examples: Contrary to popular myth, women are not worse drivers than men
Statistics disprove the myth that women are worse drivers than men.

definition:
to tell a story, often by reading aloud from a text, or to describe events as they happen
    Kể lại, thuật lại
examples: Documentaries are often narrated by well-known actors.
One by one the witnesses narrated the sequence of events which led up to the disaster.

definition:
a story or a description of a series of events
    [synonym] story
    Chuyện kể, bài tường thuật
examples: a gripping narrative of their journey up the Amazon
It's a moving narrative of wartime adventure
a first-person/third-person narrativea gripping/compelling narrative

definition:
to make a number or list of things smaller, by removing the things that are least important, necessary, or suitable
    thu hẹp danh sách (bằng cách loại bỏ những thứ không quan trọng, không phù hợp)
examples: We narrowed the list of candidates down from ten to three

definition:
beginning to exist; not yet fully developed
    Mới sinh, mới mọc, còn non trẻ
examples: a nascent industry
a nascent democracy

definition:
a country
    Dân tộc.
    Nước, quốc gia.
examples: All the nations of the world will be represented at the conference.
The Germans, as a nation, are often thought to be well organized.
Practically the whole nation watched the ceremony on television.

definition:
relating to or typical of a whole country and its people, rather than to part of that country or to other countries
    (Thuộc) Dân tộc.
    (Thuộc) Quốc gia.
examples: a national holiday
Britain has more than ten national newspapers.
The company's national headquarters is in Rome.
The children were wearing traditional national costume/dress.

definition:
the official right to belong to a particular country
    Quốc tịch
examples: She has British nationality.
What nationality are you?
All applicants will be considered regardless of age, sex, religion or nationality.
She has dual nationality (= is a citizen of two countries).

definition:
relating to or describing someone's country or place of birth
    (liên quan đến) nơi sinh, bản xứ, bản quán (của một ai đó)
examples: your native land/country/city
Her native language is Korean.

definition:
a person who speaks a language as their first language
    người bản xứ
examples: All our teachers are native speakers of English

definition:
the process by which plants, animals, etc
    that can adapt to their environment survive and reproduce, while the others disappear
    sự chọn lọc tự nhiên
examples: The process of natural selection allows the fittest creatures to survive and continue to reproduce.

definition:
the usual way that a person or an animal behaves that is part of their character
    tính, bản chất, bản tính (tự nhiên, vốn đã thế)
examples: It's not in his nature to be unkind.
She is very sensitive by nature.
We appealed to his better nature (= his kindness).

definition:
something that you need, especially in order to live
    Những thứ cần thiết, những thứ cần dùng
examples: Many people cannot even afford basic necessities such as food and clothing.
Air-conditioning is an absolute necessity in this climate.

definition:
in a way that is not necessary because it could have been avoided
    [synonym] unnecessarily
    Thừa, vô ích
    Một cách không cần thiết
examples: She'd worried needlessly about whether there would be enough food
The process was needlessly slow.

definition:
to not give enough care or attention to people or things that are your responsibility
    Sao lãng, không chú ý.
    Bỏ bê, bỏ mặc.
    Thờ ơ, hờ hững.
examples: He neglects that poor dog - he never takes him for walks or gives him any attention.
She's been neglecting her studies this semester.

definition: lân cận, bên cạnh
examples: neighbouring countries/states
She married a man from the neighbouring village.

definition:
relating to nerves
    (Thuộc) Thần kinh, (thuộc) hệ thần kinh
examples: neurological disease/damage
Alzheimer's disease is a neurological disorder.

definition:
a scientist who studies the nervous system and the brain
    nhà khoa học thần kinh,nhà thần kinh học
examples: Neuroscientists are able to record the firing of a single nerve cell

definition:
(business) an opportunity to sell a particular product to a particular group of people
    một phân khúc nhỏ, cụ thể trên thị trường (thị trường ngách)
examples: They spotted a niche in the market, with no serious competition.
a niche market
the development of niche marketing (= aiming products at particular groups)

definition:
(of natural resources such as gas or oil) that cannot be replaced after use
    (năng lượng, tài nguyên) không thể tái tạo được
examples: Oil, natural gas, and coal are non-renewable fuels.
Fossil fuels are non-renewable and rapidly running out.

definition:
a feeling of sadness mixed with pleasure and affection when you think of happy times in the past
    cảm giác bồi hồi, xúc động khi nhớ về những kỷ niệm đẹp trong quá khứ
examples: a sense/wave/pang of nostalgia
She is filled with nostalgia for her own college days.

definition:
feeling happy and also slightly sad when you think about things that happened in the past
    cảm thấy/khiến ai đó cảm thấy bồi hồi, xúc động khi nhớ về những kỷ niệm đẹp trong quá khứ
examples: Talking about our old family holidays has made me feel all nostalgic.
We'll take a nostalgic look at the musical hits of the 60s.

definition:
well known for being bad
    Khét tiếng
    (Thường, nghĩa xấu) Nổi danh, nổi tiếng; có tiếng xấu.
examples: one of Mexico's most notorious criminals
The company is notorious for paying its bills late.

definition:
the number 0 or zero
    (Toán học) Số không.
examples: He said it was only worth £10, but really you could add a couple of noughts to that (= it is really worth £1,

definition:
at the present time, in contrast with the past
    Ngày nay, đời nay, thời buổi này
examples: Nowadays most kids prefer watching TV to reading.
Nowadays, I bake my own bread rather than buy it.

definition:
a powerful form of energy produced by converting matter into energy by splitting atoms
    năng lượng hạt nhân

existing in large numbers
    [synonym] many
    Đông, đông đảo, nhiều
examples: He has been late on numerous occasions.
The advantages of this system are too numerous to mention.
Numerous studies have shown this to be true.

definition:
a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work
    Nhà trẻ.
examples: Her youngest child is at nursery now.
The children are at nursery three days a week.

definition:
any substance that plants or animals need in order to live and grow
    Chất dinh dưỡng, chất nuôi dưỡng.
examples: A healthy diet should provide all your essential nutrients

definition:
a large tree that is common in northern countries, or the hard wood of this tree
    (Thực vật học) Cây sồi
examples: a mighty oak
The timbers of those old sailing ships were mostly oak.
an oak table/cupboard

definition:
to do what you are told or expected to do
    Vâng lời nghe lời, tuân theo, tuân lệnh
examples: to obey a command/an order/rules/the law
He had always obeyed his parents without question.
(figurative) I tried to run but my legs just wouldn't obey me.
‘Sit down!’ Meekly, she obeyed.

definition:
the act of observing something or someone
    Sự quan sát, sự để ý, sự chú ý, sự theo dõi
    Lời nhận xét, điều quan sát được, điều nhận thấy.
examples: results based on scientific observations
The suspect is being kept under observation (= watched closely by the police).

definition:
to see or notice somebody/something
    Quan sát, nhận xét, theo dõi
examples: Have you observed any changes lately?
I want you to observe all the details.

definition:
unable to stop thinking about something; too interested in or worried about something
    bị ám ảnh bởi cái gì đấy
examples: Why are people so obsessed with money?
He's obsessed with Barbra Streisand and collects anything and everything connected with her.

definition:
the state in which a person’s mind is completely filled with thoughts of one particular thing or person in a way that is not normal
    Sự ảm ảnh; tình trạng bị ám ảnh
    Điều ám ảnh.
examples: He has an obsession with cleanliness
Her fear of flying is becoming an obsession.

definition:
a situation, an event, etc
    that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve something
    Vật chướng ngại, trở lực.
    Sự cản trở, sự trở ngại.
examples: The biggest obstacle in our way was a tree trunk in the road.
A lack of qualifications can be a major obstacle to finding a job.

definition:
to get something, especially by making an effort
    Đạt được, thu được, giành được, kiếm được, lấy về.
examples: I finally managed to obtain a copy of the report.
Further details can be obtained by writing to the above address.

definition:
sometimes but not often
    Thỉnh thoảng, thảng hoặc; từng thời kỳ.
examples: We occasionally meet for a drink after work.
This type of allergy can very occasionally be fatal.

definition:
[countable] a job or profession
    Nghề nghiệp; công việc, việc làm
examples: Please state your name, age and occupation below.
In the space marked "occupation" she wrote "police officer".

definition: to keep someone busy or interested
examples: a game that will occupy the kids for hours

definition:
(especially of accidents and other unexpected events) to happen
    Xảy ra, xảy đến.
examples: An accident involving over ten vehicles has occurred in the east-bound lane

definition:
an illegal act
    [synonym] crime
    Sự phạm tội; tội, lỗi
    Sự vi phạm luật lệ, sự vi phạm nội quy.
examples: Driving without a licence is an offence
He committed several serious offences
It's the third time that he's been convicted of a drug offence.

definition:
(formal) to commit a crime or crimes
    Phạm tội, làm điều lầm lỗi; vi phạm
examples: He started offending at the age of 16.
What is the best way to stop someone who has offended from repeating the offence?

definition:
rude in a way that causes you to feel upset, insulted or annoyed
    Gây xúc phạm, làm mất lòng; làm nhục, sỉ nhục
examples: The programme contains language which some viewers may find offensive.
His comments were deeply offensive to a large number of single mothers.

definition:
a member of the police force
    Cảnh sát
examples: the officer in charge of the case
the investigating officer
Yes, officer, I saw what happened.

definition:
to balance one influence against an opposing influence, so that there is no great difference as a result
    Bù lại, đền bù, bù đắp
examples: Prices have risen in order to offset the increased cost of materials
The extra cost of travelling to work is offset by the lower price of houses here.

definition:
not modern; belonging to or typical of a time in the past
    Cũ, không hợp thời trang.
    Nệ cổ, lạc hậu, hủ lậu (người).
examples: old-fashioned clothes/ideas/furniture
She's very old-fashioned in her outlook.

definition:
to not include something/somebody, either deliberately or because you have forgotten it/them
    [synonym] leave somebody/something out
    Bỏ sót, bỏ quên, bỏ đi (một từ
    )
examples: If you are a student, you can omit questions 16–18.
People were surprised that Smith was omitted from the team.

definition:
present everywhere
    Có mặt ở khắp nơi
examples: These days the media are omnipresent.
The singer became an omnipresent icon of style and beauty.
They believe that God is omnipresent.

pronunciationString: once in a lifetime
definition: used to describe something special that is not likely to happen to you again
examples: An opportunity like this comes once in a lifetime
a once-in-a-lifetime experience

definition:
(disapproving) (of an argument, opinion, etc
    ) showing only one side of the situation; not balanced
    [synonym] biased
    Một chiều, phiến diện.
    Không công bằng, thiên vị.
examples: The press were accused of presenting a very one-sided picture of the issue
They blamed their defeat on the media's one-sided reporting of the election.

definition:
the beginning of something, especially something unpleasant
    Lúc bắt đầu.
examples: the onset of winter

definition:
a musical play in which most of the words are sung, or plays and music of this type
    Ca kịch, nhạc kịch
examples: "Carmen" is my favourite opera.
I've never been a huge fan of opera.
What skills are needed to operate this machinery?

definition:
strong disagreement
    Sự chống lại, sự chống cự, sự phản đối
examples: There is a lot of opposition to the proposed changes.
The unions are in opposition to the government over the issue of increasing the minimum wage.

definition:
a thin glass thread through which light can be transmitted (= sent)
    sợi quang học, cáp quang

someone who always believes that good things will happen
    (người luôn lạc quan)
examples: An optimist looks at the glass and says its half full.

definition:
hoping or believing that good things will happen in the future
    (lạc quan, đầy hy vọng)
examples: The doctor said she was optimistic about the outcome of the operation

definition:
of, taken by, or done to the mouth
    (Giải phẫu) (thuộc) miệng.
examples: oral hygiene
oral surgery

definition:
a round sweet fruit that has a thick orange skin and an orange centre divided into many parts
    Quả cam.
    Cây cam.
examples: a glass of orange juice
Vitamin C is found in oranges and other citrus fruit.

definition:
a large ape (= an animal like a large monkey with no tail) with long arms and reddish hair, that lives in Borneo and Sumatra
    Đười ươi hay còn gọi là dã nhân hay người rừng

the curved path through which objects in space move around a planet or star
    Quỹ đạo
examples: The satellite is now in a stable orbit.
Once in space, the spacecraft will go into orbit around Earth.

definition:
connected with the orbit of a planet or object in space
    (Thuộc) Quỹ đạo
examples: an orbital space station

definition:
a large group of musicians who play many different instruments together and are led by a conductor
    Ban nhạc, dàn nhạc
examples: She's a cellist in the City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra
She plays the flute in the school orchestra.

definition:
not unusual or different in any way
    Thường, thông thường, bình thường, tầm thường
examples: an ordinary sort of day
ordinary people like you and me
an ordinary neighbourhood
Readers of the magazine said they wanted more stories about ordinary people and fewer stories about the rich and famous.

definition: to arrange something or the parts of something into a particular order or structure
examples: The books were organized on the shelves according to their size

definition:
having a lot of complicated decoration
    Trang trí công phu, trang sức lộng lẫy.
examples: a room with an ornate ceiling and gold mirrors
This style is a little too ornate for my taste.

definition:
a very large bird from Africa that cannot fly
    (Động vật học) Đà điểu Châu phi
examples: The ostrich is the fastest animal on two legs

definition:
on the outside of something
    [synonym] external
    Ở phía ngoài, ở xa hơn
examples: the outer space — vũ trụ, khoảng không ngoài quyển khíthe outer world — thế giới vật chất bên ngoài, xã hội bên ngoài

definition:
(business) a shop/store or an organization that sells goods made by a particular company or of a particular type
    cửa hàng tiêu thụ, cửa hàng đại lý (của một hãng).
examples: The business has 34 retail outlets in this state alone.
a fast-food outleta retail outlet

definition:
to be greater or more important than something
    Có nhiều tác dụng hơn, có nhiều giá trị hơn, có nhiều ảnh hưởng hơn
examples: The advantages far outweigh the disadvantages.
The benefits would surely far outweigh the risks.

definition:
to succeed in dealing with or controlling a problem that has been preventing you from achieving something
    vượt qua, chiến thắng
examples: She overcame injury to win the Olympic gold medal.
Eventually she managed to overcome her shyness in class.

definition:
to do something too much; to exaggerate something
    Làm quá trớn, làm quá
    Làm mất tác dụng vì quá cường điệu, cường điệu hoá hỏng.
    Nấu quá nhừ.
examples: Don't overdo the salt in the food.
Use illustrations where appropriate but don't overdo it.

definition:
the act of eating more than you need or more than is healthy
    Ăn quá nhiều, ăn quá mức.
examples: She went through periods of compulsive overeating

definition:
a situation in which there are too many cows or other animals eating grass in an area, which damages the environment
    Chăn thả quá mức
examples: Another problem is erosion of stream banks caused by overgrazing

definition:
to fail to notice or consider something or someone
    Không nhận thấy, không chú ý tới.
examples: He seems to have overlooked one important fact.
In my hurry to finish the exam I had overlooked part of one of the questions.

definition:
the fact of a country or city having too many people living in it
    Sự đông dân quá mức
examples: the problems of overpopulation

definition:
too expensive; costing more than it is worth
    có giá cao quá mức
examples: These shoes are very nice, but they're really overpriced
ridiculously overpriced designer clothes

definition:
wishing to protect someone, especially a child, too much
    Bảo vệ quá mức cần thiết.
examples: overprotective parents
The children of overprotective parents often do not develop the skills they need to take care of themselves when they leave home.

definition:
more important than anything else in a particular situation
    Quan trọng hơn bất cứ nhận định nào khác
examples: the overriding factor/consideration/concern
Their overriding aim was to keep costs low.
Time was of overriding importance.

definition:
in, from, or to other countries
    ngoài nước, hải ngoại
examples: There are a lot of overseas students studying at our college.
My brother is a student overseas.
Many more people go/travel/live/work overseas these days.

definition:
time that you spend working at your job after you have worked the normal hours
    Giờ làm thêm
examples: They're doing/working overtime to get the job done on time
Everyone is on overtime (= being paid extra for working after the usual time) this weekend.

definition:
(of people) too heavy and fat
    [opposite] underweight
    (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Béo quá.
examples: She was only a few pounds overweight

definition:
to give too much of a thing to a person
    giao cho ai đó quá nhiều việc, làm quá tải ai đó
examples: We were overwhelmed by requests for information.

definition:
the speed at which someone or something moves, or with which something happens or changes
    Bước chân, bước
    Bước đi; nhịp đi; tốc độ đi, tốc độ chạy.
    Nhịp độ tiến triển, tốc độ tiến triển.
examples: a slow/fast pace
When she thought she heard someone following her, she quickened her pace.
Could you slow down - I can't keep pace with (= walk or run as fast as) you.

definition:
materials used to wrap or protect goods that are sold in shops/stores
    bao bì
examples: Attractive packaging can help to sell products

definition:
a field of any size that is used for farming
    Mảnh ruộng, mảnh đất

a drug that reduces pain
    thuốc giảm đau
examples: The body produces chemicals that are natural painkillers
She's on (= taking) painkillers.

definition:
a picture made using paint
    the act or art of using paint to produce pictures
    Hội hoạ.
    Bức vẽ, bức tranh.
examples: The walls are covered in oil paintings.
Her hobbies include music and painting.

definition:
a tree that grows in hot countries and has a tall trunk with a mass of long pointed leaves at the top
    (Thực vật học) Cây cọ, cây họ cau dừa
examples: date palms
palm fronds
The island has long golden beaches fringed by palm trees.

definition:
the photographers who follow famous people everywhere they go in order to take photographs of them for newspapers and magazines
    những tay săn ảnh chuyên theo dõi người nổi tiếng để chụp ảnh bán lại cho báo chí

a place or condition of great happiness where everything is exactly as you would like it to be
    Thiên đường, nơi cực lạc
examples: a tropical paradise
His idea of paradise is to spend the day lying on the beach.
This mall is a shopper's paradise.

definition:
a person’s father or mother
    Cha; mẹ
examples: He's still living with his parents.
her adoptive parents
Sue and Ben have recently become parents.
It can be difficult to be a good parent.

definition:
connected with a parent or parents
    (Thuộc) Cha mẹ
    (Liên quan đến) cha mẹ
examples: parental responsibility/rights
parental choice in education
parental advice/influenceThe government repeatedly stressed its support for parental choice in the selection of a child's school.

definition:
not complete or whole
    Bộ phận; cục bộ, một phần, bán phần
examples: It was only a partial solution to the problem.
a partial eclipse of the sun

definition:
used to emphasize that you are referring to a specific person, thing or type of thing and not others
    cụ thể, đặc biệt, đặc thù
examples: There is one particular patient I'd like you to see.
Is there a particular type of book he enjoys?

definition:
especially, or more than usual
    Đặc biệt là, nhất là, cụ thể là.
examples: Traffic is bad, particularly in the city centre

definition:
[law/proposal]to accept a proposal, law, etc
    by voting
    Phê duyệt, thông qua, chấp nhận (dự luật, đề xuất)
examples: The bill was passed by 360 votes to 280
The government passed a law to restrict the sale of guns
The food supplement had been passed as safe for human consumption.
airline/rail/train/car passengers

definition:
land where animals can feed on grass
    đất để trồng cỏ chăn thả gia súc
examples: To raise one cow requires an acre of rich pastureland

definition:
an official right to be the only person to make, use or sell a product or an invention; a document that proves this
    Bằng sáng chế
    đặc quyền chế tạo, đặc quyền phân phối một phát minh, một sản phẩm nào đó
examples: In 1880 Alexander Graham Bell was granted a patent on an apparatus for signalling and communicating called a Photophone.
to apply for/obtain a patent on an inventionThe device was protected by patent.
Look, the frost has made a beautiful pattern on the window.
The curtains had a floral pattern.
I found paw prints in the kitchen

definition:
a person who lends money in exchange for objects that he or she can sell if the person leaving the objects does not pay an agreed amount of money in an agreed time
    Chủ hiệu cầm đồ
examples: at the pawnbroker's — đang đem cầm, đang ở hiệu cầm đồ (đồ)

definition:
a shop where a pawnbroker operates his or her business
    Hiệu cầm đồ

quiet and calm
    yên ổn, thanh bình
examples: a peaceful afternoon/place

definition:
the highest, strongest, or best point, value
    đỉnh cao nhất, tột đỉnh, cao điểm
examples: Prices reach a peak during August

definition:
a person who is the same age or who has the same social status as you
    Người cùng tuổi, cùng địa vị xã hội, người ngang hàng, người tương đương.
examples: Do you think it's true that teenage girls are less self-confident than their male peers?
He wasn't a great scholar, but as a teacher he had few peers (= not as many people had the same ability as him).

definition:
expressing disapproval, or suggesting that something is not good or is of no importance
    Có nghĩa xấu (từ), có nghĩa phê phán
examples: Make sure students realize that "fat" is a pejorative word.
I'm using the word ‘academic’ here in a pejorative sense.

definition:
to notice or become aware of something
    Thấy, trông thấy; nghe thấy, cảm thấy, ngửi thấy
examples: perceive something in his behaviour.
She perceived that all was not well.

definition:
a person who entertains people by acting, singing, dancing, or playing music
    Người biểu diễn
examples: He's a brilliant performer

definition:
arts such as music, dance, and drama that are performed for an audience
    Nghệ thuật biểu diễn (sử dụng cơ thể, tiếng nói và sự có mặt của chính nghệ sĩ làm phương tiện trình diễn trước công chúng)
examples: Performing arts may include dance, music, opera, theatre and musical theatre, magic, illusion, mime, spoken word, puppetry, circus arts, performance art, recitation and public speaking
There is also a specialized form of fine art, in which the artists perform their work live to an audience

definition:
a length of time
    thời kỳ, giai đoạn, thời gian.
examples: Her work means that she spends long periods away from home.
Unemployment in the first half of the year was 2
5 percent lower than in the same period the year before.

definition:
to die, especially in an accident or by being killed, or to be destroyed
    Diệt vong; chết; bỏ mạng, bỏ mình.
    Tàn lụi, héo rụi; hỏng đi.
examples: Three hundred people perished in the earthquake.
He believes that Europe must create closer ties or it will perish.
perishable goods/foods
Many fresh foods are highly perishable.
It's important to store perishable food in a cool place.

definition:
[usually plural] something you receive as well as your wages for doing a particular job
    Bổng lộc, tiền thù lao thêm.
    Vật hưởng thừa.
examples: Perks offered by the firm include a car and free health insurance.
A company car and a mobile phone are some of the perks that come with the job.
(figurative) Not having to get up early is just one of the perks of being retired.

definition:
to commit a crime or do something wrong or evil
    Phạm, gây ra
examples: to perpetrate a crime/fraud/massacre
In this country, half of all violent crime is perpetrated by people who have been drinking alcohol.

definition:
formal form of "perks"
    dạng đầy đủ của từ "perks"
examples: The perquisites of this job include health insurance and a performance bonus

definition:
to continue trying to do or achieve something despite difficulties
    (+ in, with) Kiên nhẫn, kiên trì; bền gan, bền chí.
examples: Despite a number of setbacks, they persevered in their attempts to fly around the world in a balloon
She persevered with her violin lessons.

definition:
lasting for a long time or difficult to get rid of
    Dai dẳng, mãi không khỏi.
examples: Symptoms of the illness include a high temperature and a persistent dry cough

definition:
a famous person
    Nhân vật, người nổi tiếng (nhất là trong giới văn nghệ, giới thể thao)
examples: The show is hosted by a popular TV personality.

definition:
to make somebody do something by giving them good reasons for doing it
    Làm cho tin; thuyết phục.
examples: If she doesn't want to go, nothing you can say will persuade her.
He is trying to persuade local and foreign businesses to invest in the project.

definition:
existing in all parts of a place or thing; spreading gradually to affect all parts of a place or thing
    Toả khắp.
    Lan tràn khắp, thâm nhập khắp.
examples: The influence of Freud is pervasive in her books.
a pervasive smell of diesel
Reforms are being undermined by the all-pervasive corruption in the country.

definition:
a person who always expects bad things to happen
    (người bi quan)
examples: A pessimist looks at the glass and says its half empty.

definition:
thinking that bad things are more likely to happen or emphasizing the bad part of a situation
    (bi quan, sầu não)
examples: The doctors are pessimistic (= not hopeful) about his chances of recovery.

definition:
an insect or animal that destroys plants, food, etc
    động vật, côn trùng làm hại mùa màng
examples: pest control
common pests such as rats, mice, or cockroaches

definition:
a chemical used for killing pests, especially insects
    Thuốc trừ vật hại (sâu chuột làm hại hoa màu)
examples: vegetables grown without the use of pesticides
crops sprayed with pesticide

definition:
any of the usually brightly coloured parts that together form most of a flower
    (Thực vật học) Cánh hoa
examples: rose petals

definition:
a liquid obtained from petroleum, used as fuel in car engines, etc
    xăng
examples: to fill a car up with petrol
to run out of petrol
the petrol tank of a car
an increase in petrol prices

definition:
a person who is trained to prepare and give out medicines in a hospital or shop
    dược sĩ
examples: We had to wait for the pharmacist to make up her prescription

definition:
a stage in a process of change or development
    thời kỳ (phát triển, biến đổi).
examples: he project is only in its initial phase as yet, but it's looking quite promising.
We're entering a new phase in international relations.

definition:
the abbreviation for [‘Doctor of Philosophy’ ](a university degree of a very high level that is given to somebody who has done research in a particular subject)
    bằng tiến sĩ, học vị tiến sĩ
examples: a PhD student/thesis
Susannah has a PhD in Italian literature.
She's a PhD.

definition:
the plural form of "phenomenon"
    (các) hiện tượng
examples: cultural/natural/social phenomena
Early retirement is a relatively new phenomenon in Britain.

definition:
something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc
    , especially something unusual or interesting
    Hiện tượng
examples: Gravity is a natural phenomenon.

definition:
relating to the body
    (Thuộc) Thân thể, (thuộc) cơ thể, của thân thể.
examples: physical exercise/fitness/strength/disabilities
I'm not a very physical sort of person (= I don't enjoy physical activities).

definition:
a doctor, especially one who is a specialist in general medicine and not surgery
    Thầy thuốc

a person who steals money, etc
    from other people’s pockets, especially in crowded places
    Kẻ móc túi
examples: Watch out for pickpockets, especially at the train station

definition:
a person who operates the controls of an aircraft, especially as a job
    (Hàng không) Người lái (máy bay), phi công
examples: an airline pilot
a fighter pilot
The accident was caused by pilot error.

definition:
an evergreen forest tree with leaves like needles
    (Thực vật học) Cây thông.
examples: pine forests
pine needles

definition:
a person who is one of the first people to do something
    Người đi tiên phong, người đi đầu (trong một công cuộc gì); nhà thám hiểm đầu tiên
examples: one of the pioneers of modern science
a pioneer in the field of microsurgery

definition:
to cause pain or trouble to somebody/something over a period of time
    [synonym] trouble
    Gây bệnh dịch cho
    Gây tai hoạ cho, gây tai hại cho, gây tệ hại cho
examples: Financial problems have been plaguing their new business partners.
My shoulder's been plaguing me all week.

definition:
to twist three or more long pieces of hair, rope, etc
    together to make one long piece
    Tết, bện
examples: She plaited the horse's tail.
a plaited leather bracelet/belt

definition:
a factory or place where power is produced or an industrial process takes place
    nhà máy
examples: a nuclear reprocessing plant
Japanese car plants
a chemical plant

definition:
a flat raised area or structure
    Nền, bục, bệ

a piece of writing that is intended to be acted in a theatre or on radio or television
    Kịch, vở kịch, vở tuồng
examples: a radio play
"Did you see the play (= the performance of the play) on Thursday?" "No, I went on Wednesday night

definition:
to dig and turn over a field or other area of land witha large farming tool
    Cày (một thửa ruộng, một luống cày).
    Xới (một đường).
examples: Farmers start ploughing in the spring.
We're going to plough the top field next week.
Large areas of grazing land have been ploughed up to grow wheat.

definition:
to catch and kill animals without permission on someone else's land
    Săn trộm, câu trộm
examples: The farmer claimed that he shot the men because they were poaching on his land
to poach hares — săn trộm thỏ rừng

definition:
someone who catches and kills animals illegally
    Người săn trộm, người câu trộm
examples: The measures are designed to protect the fish from poachers

definition:
(especially British English) (also [allowance] especially in North American English)
    a small amount of money that parents give their children, usually every week or every month
    tiền bỏ túi, tiền tiêu vặt
examples: My dad gives me £5 a week pocket money

definition:
having no purpose; not worth doing
    vô nghĩa, vô dụng
examples: We searched until we knew it would be pointless to continue.
Trying to foresee the future is a pointless exercise.

definition:
causing death or illness if swallowed or absorbed into the body
    [synonym] toxic
    Độc, có chất độc
examples: poisonous chemicals/plants
This gas is highly poisonous.
The leaves of certain trees are poisonous to cattle.

definition:
a white bear that lives near the North Pole
    gấu trắng (sống gần Bắc Cực)

a long, thin stick of wood or metal, often used standing straight up in the ground to support things
    cột, sào, cọc chống
examples: a telegraph/electricity pole
A flag fluttered from a 40-foot pole.

definition:
a substance that pollutes something, especially air and water
    Chất gây ô nhiễm (do xe cộ, động cơ thải ra)
examples: Sulphur dioxide is one of several pollutants that are released into the atmosphere by coal-fired power stations

definition:
to add dirty or harmful substances to land, air, water, etc
    so that it is no longer pleasant or safe to use
    làm ô nhiễm, gây nhiễm bẩn (nguồn nước, bầu không khí,
    )
examples: the exhaust fumes that are polluting our cities
The river has been polluted with toxic waste from local factories.

definition:
the process of making air, water, soil, etc
    dirty; the state of being dirty
    sự ô nhiễm
examples: air/water pollution
to reduce levels of environmental pollution

definition:
a fruit similar to a grapefruit but larger and sweeter, with pale green or yellow skin and white flesh
    Quả bưởi

a small area of still water, especially one that is artificial
    ao
examples: a fish pond

definition:
to think about something carefully for a period of time
    synonym consider
    suy nghĩ,cân nhắc.
examples: She sat back for a minute to ponder her next move in the game
We intend to ponder all the alternatives before acting
They are pondering whether the money could be better used elsewhere
‘I wonder why,’ she pondered aloud.

definition:
that is easy to carry or to move
    Có thể mang theo, xách tay
    Di động.
examples: a portable TV
The equipment is lightweight, portable and easy to store.

definition:
an amount of food that is large enough for one person
    Phần, phần chia
    Phần thức ăn (đựng ở đĩa đem lên cho khách, ở quán ăn).
examples: She cut the cake into six small portions.
You should eat several portions of fruit a day.

definition:
a painting, photograph, drawing, etc
    of a person or, less commonly, of a group of people
    Chân dung, ảnh
examples: She's commissioned an artist to paint her portrait/paint a portrait of her.
He had his portrait painted in uniform.

definition:
a chance that something may happen or be true
    Sự có thể, tình trạng có thể, khả năng
examples: It's not likely to happen but I wouldn't rule out the possibility.
The forecast said that there's a possibility of snow tonight.

definition:
a vertical stick or pole stuck into the ground, usually to support something or show a position
    Cột trụ.
examples: corner posts (= that mark the corners of a sports field)
The team’s ‘net’ was a piece of string tied to two posts.

definition:
a student who has already received one degree and is studying at a university for a more advanced degree
    Nghiên cứu sinh (người đang học sau đại học).
examples: postgraduate students
a postgraduate course

definition:
happening or existing in the period after a war, especially the First or Second World War
    Hậu chiến; tồn tại sau chiến tranh, xảy ra sau chiến tranh
examples: the postwar period of economic expansion — thời kỳ khuếch trương kinh tế sau chiến tranhpostwar developments in industry — những phát triển về công nghiệp thời hậu chiến

definition:
that can develop into something or be developed in the future
    [synonym] possible
    Tiềm tàng
examples: potential customers
First we need to identify actual and potential problems.

definition:
the condition of being extremely poor
    Sự nghèo nàn; cảnh nghèo nàn, cảnh bần cùng
examples: He emigrated to Australia to escape the grinding (= very great) poverty of his birthplace.
Helping to alleviate poverty in developing countries also helps to reduce environmental destruction.
The aircraft is powered by a jet engine.
The plant generates enough energy to power a town of 6 000 people.
The mill’s machinery is powered by waterwheels.

definition:
a building or group of buildings where electricity is produced
    nhà máy sản xuất điện

to happen before something or come before something/somebody in order
    Đi trước; đứng trước; đặt trước; ở trước; có trước, đến trước.
examples: Kofi Annan preceded Ban Ki-moon as the Secretary-General of the UN.
It would be helpful if you were to precede the report with an introduction.

definition:
to have existed or happened before another thing
    có trước một thứ gì đó khác
examples: Few of the town's fine buildings predate the earthquake of 1755

definition:
an animal that hunts, kills, and eats other animals
    Thú ăn mồi sống, thú ăn thịt.
examples: lions, wolves, and other predators

definition:
to say that something will happen in the future
    [synonym] forecast
    Nói trước; đoán trước, dự đoán
examples: a reliable method of predicting earthquakes
Nobody could predict the outcome.

definition:
the state of being likely to behave in a particular way or to suffer from a particular disease
    Tình trạng dễ thiên về, khuynh hướng thiên về.
    (Y học) Tố bẩm (dễ mắc bệnh gì).
examples: These are parents with a predisposition to worry

definition: Được làm sẵn, được đúc sẵn
examples: a prefabricated house
Prefabricated houses were quickly put up after the war

definition:
to like one thing or person better than another; to choose one thing rather than something else because you like it better
    thích hơn, ưa hơn
examples: ‘Coffee or tea?’ ‘I'd prefer tea, thanks
The donor prefers to remain anonymous.

definition:
connected with the time in history before information was written down
    (thuộc} Tiền sử.
examples: prehistoric man/humans/animals

definition:
an unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge
    Định kiến, thành kiến, thiên kiến
examples: Their decision was based on ignorance and prejudice
I must admit to a prejudice in favour of British universities.

definition:
​to base a theory, argument, etc
    on an idea, thought, or belief
    lấy cơ sở cho lời nói, lý thuyết, ý tưởng,
    của mình dựa trên cái gì đó
examples: He premised his argument on several incorrect assumptions
I've been prescribed painkillers
The doctor prescribed some pills.

definition:
a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs
    (Y học) Sự cho đơn; đơn thuốc
examples: The doctor gave me a prescription for antibiotics
These drugs are only available on prescription (= with a prescription from a doctor).

definition:
the fact that someone or something is in a place
    Sự có mặt
examples: He hardly seemed to notice my presence.
Her presence during the crisis had a calming effect.
She was overawed by the presence of so many people.

definition:
(of a person) being in a particular place
    opposite absent
    Có mặt, hiện diện.
examples: Most fathers wish to be present at the birth of their child.
There were 200 people present at the meeting.
The mistake was obvious to all those present.
I wasn’t present when the doctor examined him.

definition:
to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed
    Giữ, giữ gìn, bảo quản, bảo tồn, duy trì
examples: Carefully follow instructions to preserve foods safely
He was anxious to preserve his reputation.

definition:
newspapers and magazines, and those parts of television and radio that broadcast news, or reporters and photographers who work for them
    Báo chí
examples: The story was reported in the press and on television.
the freedom of the Press/press freedom (= the freedom to report any events and express opinions)

definition:
needing to be dealt with immediately
    [synonym] urgent
    Thúc bách, cấp bách, cấp thiết gấp
examples: I'm afraid I have some pressing business to attend to.
The government seems to think that international problems are more pressing than domestic ones.

definition:
at a time before the time that you are talking about
    Trước, trước đây.
examples: The building had previously been used as a hotel
I had visited them three days previously.

definition:
an animal that is hunted and killed for food by another animal
    động vật bị ăn thịt; con mồi
examples: A hawk hovered in the air before swooping on its prey

definition:
mainly
    [synonym] chiefly
    Trước hết, đầu tiên.
    Chủ yếu, chính.
examples: a course designed primarily for specialists
The problem is not primarily a financial one.

definition:
main; most important; basic
    Chủ yếu, chính, bậc nhất.
examples: The money I earn is extra, my husband's job is our primary source of income

definition:
belonging to an early stage in the development of humans or animals
    Nguyên thuỷ, ban sơ
    Thô sơ, cổ xưa.
examples: primitive man

definition:
most important; main
    Chính, chủ yếu
examples: Iraq's principal export is oil.
He was principal dancer at the Dance Theatre of Harlem.
That was my principal reason for moving.

definition:
before a particular time or event
    trước khi
examples: the weekprior to her death

definition:
to decide which of a group of things are the most important so that you can deal with them first
    Dành ưu tiên
examples: You must learn to prioritize your work
You should make a list of all the jobs you have to do and prioritize them.

definition:
something that you think is more important than other things and should be dealt with first
    Sự ưu tiên; điều được xét trước hết
examples: Education is a top priority
My first/top priority is to find somewhere to live.

definition:
a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime they have committed, or while they are waiting for trial
    [synonym] jail
    Nhà tù, nhà lao, nhà giam
examples: He was sent to prison for five years.
She is in prison, awaiting trial.

definition:
a person who is kept in prison as a punishment, or while they are waiting for trial
    Người bị giam giữ, người tù; con vật bị nhốt.
examples: The number of prisoners serving life sentences has fallen.
They are demanding the release of all political prisoners.

definition:
fresh and clean, as if new
    đẹp như mới, nguyên vẹn (đồ vật)
    sạch tinh khiết (nước)
examples: The car is in pristine condition.
a pristine white tablecloth

definition:
the state of being alone and not watched or disturbed by other people
    the state of being free from the attention of the public
    Sự riêng tư
examples: The new law is designed to protect people's privacy
I hate sharing a bedroom - I never get any privacy.
You can close this curtain to give you a little more privacy.

definition:
a school that receives no money from the government and where the education of the students is paid for by their parents
    trường tư (học sinh phải tự trả toàn bộ tiền học phí)

likely to happen, to exist or to be true
    Có thể có, có khả năng xảy ra, chắc hẳn, có lễ đúng, có lẽ thật
examples: The probable cause of death was heart failure.
An election in June seems increasingly probable.

definition:
food or any other substance or material that is grown or obtained through farming
    nông sản
examples: farm produce
The shop sells only fresh local produce.

definition:
doing or achieving a lot
    [synonym] fruitful
    làm được nhiều, sản xuất được nhiều, năng suất cao
examples: In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.
He had an amazingly productive five years in which he managed to write four novels.

definition:
any type of work that needs special training or a particular skill, often one that is respected because it involves a high level of education
    bất kỳ loại công việc nào cần đào tạo đặc biệt hoặc một kỹ năng đặc biệt, thường là được tôn trọng vì nó yêu cầutrình độ học vấn cao
examples: He left the teaching profession in 1965 to start his own business.
The report notes that 40 percent of lawyers entering the profession are women.
Teaching as a profession is very underpaid.
He's a doctor by profession.

definition:
felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
    Sâu sắc, hết sức, hoàn toàn
examples: profound changes in the earth’s climate
My father's death had a profound effect on us all.
The news came as a profound shock.

definition:
to improve or develop over a period of time; to make progress
    [synonym] advance
    Tiến tới; tiến bộ; tiến triển, phát triển
examples: The course allows students to progress at their own speed.
Work on the new road is progressing slowly.

definition:
a calculation or guess about the future based on information that you have
    (Kinh tế học) Sự dự tính, sự dự đoán
examples: to make forward/backward projections of population figures
Sales have exceeded our projections.

definition:
to make something last longer
    [synonym] extend
    Kéo dài; nối dài; gia hạn
examples: The operation could prolong his life by two or three years.
We were having such a good time that we decided to prolong our stay by another week.

definition:
easily seen
    [synonym] noticeable
    dễ thấy, nổi bật
examples: The church tower was a prominent feature in the landscape.
The story was given a prominent position on the front page.

definition:
to help something to happen or develop
    Làm tăng tiến, đẩy mạnh, xúc tiến, khuyến khích.
examples: policies to promote economic growth

definition:
to push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force
    Đẩy đi, đẩy tới ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng))
examples: a rocket propelled through space
The Kon-Tiki sailed across the Pacific Ocean propelled by wind power.

definition:
(formal) a quality or characteristic that something has
    Đặc tính, thuộc tính, tính chất
examples: a plant with medicinal properties
One of the properties of copper is that it conducts heat and electricity very well.

definition:
the number, amount, or level of one thing when compared to another
    Tỷ lệ
examples: The proportion of women to men at my college was about five to one
Water covers a large proportion of the earth's surface.

definition:
a suggestion, sometimes a written one
    Sự đề nghị, sự đề xuất.
    Điều đề nghị, dự kiến đề nghị, kế hoạch đề xuất.
examples: to submit/consider/accept/reject a proposal
a proposal to build more office accommodation

definition:
to offer or suggest a possible plan or action for other people to consider
    Đề nghị, đề xuất, đưa ra
examples: I propose that we wait until the budget has been announced before committing ourselves to any expenditure
He proposed dealing directly with the suppliers.

definition:
an offer or suggestion, usually in business
    Lời đề nghị, kế hoạch, đề xuất, dự kiến đề ra
examples: He wrote to me last week regarding a business proposition he thought might interest me.
I've put my proposition to the company director for his consideratio

definition:
a legal official who accuses someone of committing a crime, especially in a law court
    Công tố viên; kiểm sát viên
examples: The tape recordings provided prosecutors with the evidence they needed to prove he'd been involved in the conspiracy.
a public/state prosecutor

definition:
the possibility that something will happen
    Cảnh, toàn cảnh, viễn cảnh
    Hy vọng ở tương lai, triển vọng tương lai, tiền đồ.
examples: Is there any prospect of the weather improving?There seems little prospect of an end to the dispute
+ that  There's not much prospect that this war will be over soon
There's every prospect of success.

definition:
to show that you disagree with something by standing somewhere, shouting, carrying signs, etc
    :
    biểu tình
examples: A big crowd of demonstrators were protesting against cuts in health spending.
Outside, a group of students were protesting research cuts.

definition:
the first design of something from which other forms are copied or developed
    mẫu thiết kế đầu tiên, nguyên mẫu
examples: the prototype of the modern bicycle
Scientists have developed a working prototype for a voice translation machine.

definition:
to cause a particular reaction or have a particular effect
    Kích thích, khêu gợi, gây
examples: The announcement provoked a storm of protest.
The article was intended to provoke discussion.
Dairy products may provoke allergic reactions in some people.
a house in the proximity of (= near) the motorway
The proximity of the college to London makes it very popular.
The area has a number of schools in close proximity to each other
The site is in close proximity to an airport

definition:
a book, magazine, newspaper, or document in which information or stories are published
    ấn bản, sách báo xuất bản
examples: Our latest publication is a magazine for health enthusiasts

definition:
the activity of making certain that someone or something attracts a lot of interest or attention from many people
    the attention that is given to somebody/something by newspapers, television, etc.
    sự quảng bá, sự quảng cáo, sự công bố rộng rãi
    sự chú ý của báo, đài, truyền thông; sự bàn tán rộng rãi của quần chúng
examples: He’s in charge of the publicity for next year’s festival
He attracted a lot of adverse/bad publicity with his speech about unmarried mothers.

definition:
to make information about something generally available
    Đưa ra công khai; làm cho thiên hạ biết đến.
    Quảng cáo, làm cho mọi người biết.
examples: He was in London publicizing his new biography of Kennedy.
The event was well publicized all over town.
The work of the charity has been widely publicized throughout the media.

definition:
a free local school paid for by the government
    trường công (học phí được chính phủ hỗ trợ, hoặc miễn phí)

the system of buses, trains, etc
    provided by the government or by companies, which people use to travel from one place to another
    phương tiện giao thông công cộng
examples: to travel on/by public transport
Most of us use public transport to get to work.

definition:
to make information available to people, especially in a book, magazine, or newspaper, or to produce and sell a book, magazine, or newspaper
    Công bố
    Xuất bản (sách
    ).
examples: The names of the winners of the competition will be published in June.
She was only 19 when her first novel was published.
Several publishers are competing in the same market

definition:
a large, round vegetable with hard, yellow or orange flesh
    Quả bí ngô
examples: pumpkin pie

definition:
arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late
    Đúng giờ (không chậm trễ).
examples: He's fairly punctual (= he usually arrives on time)
She has been reliable and punctual.
Always be punctual for an interview.

definition:
the fact of happening or doing something at the agreed or correct time and not being late
    sự đúng giờ, tính đúng giờ
examples: There is a bonus scheme for employees who show good performance and punctuality
He insists on regular attendance and punctuality.

definition:
to make a small hole in something; to get a small hole
    Đâm thủng, châm thủng, chích thủng
examples: to puncture a tyre
She had used a screwdriver to puncture two holes in the lid

definition:
to cause someone who has done something wrong or committed a crime to suffer, by hurting them, forcing them to pay money, sending them to prison, etc.
    Phạt, trừng phạt, trừng trị
examples: Those responsible for these crimes must be brought to court and punished.
He punished the class by giving them extra work.
The oil company was found guilty on ten counts of pollution, and was punished with a $250 million fine.

definition:
(of a crime) that can be punished, especially by law
    Có thể bị trừng phạt, trừng phạt, đáng trừng trị
examples: a crime punishable by/with imprisonment
Giving false information to the police is a punishable offence.

definition:
the act of punishing someone
    Sự phạt, sự trừng phạt, sự trừng trị.
examples: Many people think that the death penalty is too severe a punishment for any crime.
It was always our father who administered/meted out punishments.
Drink-driving is one case in which severe punishment seems to work as a deterrent

definition:
the act of buying something
    something that you buy
    Sự mua, sự tậu được; vật mua được, vật tậu được
examples: A house is the most expensive purchase that most people ever make
How do you wish to pay for your purchases?

definition:
a large building with a square or triangular base and sloping sides that meet in a point at the top
    The ancient Egyptians built stone pyramids as places to bury their kings and queens
    kim tự tháp (Ai-cập)
    (Toán học) Hình chóp.

attractive because of being unusual and especially old-fashioned
    Có vẻ cổ cổ là lạ; nhìn hay hay là lạ.
examples: a quaint seaside village

definition:
an official record showing that you have finished a training course or have the necessary skills, etc
    bằng cấp, chứng chỉ
examples: You'll never get a good job if you don't have any qualifications.
Do you have any teaching/academic qualifications?

definition:
to reach the standard of ability or knowledge needed to do a particular job
    (+ for) Có đủ tư cách, có đủ khả năng, có đủ tiêu chuẩn.
    Qua kỳ thi sát hạch, qua kỳ thi tuyển lựa, tuyên thệ (để đảm nhiệm chức vụ gì
    ).
examples: He qualified as a doctor last year
She hopes to qualify (as a lawyer) at the end of the year
This course qualifies you to teach in any secondary school.

definition:
to measure or judge the size or amount of something
    Xác định số lượng.
examples: It's difficult to quantify how many people will be affected by the change
The risks to health are impossible to quantify.

definition:
an amount or a number of something
    Lượng, số lượng, đại lượng
examples: a large/small quantity of something
enormous/vast/huge quantities of food
a product that is cheap to produce in large quantities
Is it available in sufficient quantity?

definition:
a place where large amounts of stone, etc
    are dug out of the ground
    Nơi lấy đá, mỏ đá.
examples: a granite/limestone/marble/slate quarry

definition:
a long search for something that is difficult to find, or an attempt to achieve something difficult
    sự tìm kiếm, theo đuổi, đặc biệt là một thứ khó đạt được, khó tìm thấy
examples: Nothing will stop them in their quest for truth.
+ to infinitive  She does aerobics four times a week in her quest to achieve the perfect body.

definition:
that you have doubts about because you think it is not accurate or correct
    [synonym] debatable
    Đáng ngờ, thiếu chắc chắn
examples: The conclusions that they come to are highly questionable.
It is questionable whether this is a good way of solving the problem.

definition:
line of people, cars, etc
    waiting for something or to do something
    Hàng (người, xe ô tô ở ngã tư khi có đèn đỏ
    ) xếp nối đuôi
examples: There was a long queue of traffic stretching down the road
If you want tickets you'll have to join the queue
disapproving It makes me mad when someone jumps the queue (= goes straight to the front).

definition:
powerful and very dangerous rays that are sent out from radioactive substances
    bức xạ, phóng xạ
examples: The radiation leak has had a disastrous effect on the environment.
It is feared that people living near the power station may have been exposed to radiation.

definition:
very quickly; at a great rate
    Nhanh, nhanh chóng, mau lẹ
examples: a rapidly growing economy
Crime figures are rising rapidly

definition:
a wheel or bar with teeth along the edge and a metal piece that fits between the teeth, allowing movement in one direction only
    bánh cóc

(of materials) in its natural state; not yet changed, used or made into something else
    Thô, chưa tinh chế, còn nguyên chất, sống
examples: Oil is an important raw material that can be processed into many different products, including plastics.
I'm a realist - I knew there was no way I could win, so I swam for a good finish, for points.

definition:
accepting things as they are in fact and not making decisions based on unlikely hopes for the future
    (có óc thực tế)
examples: We have to be realistic about our chances of winning

definition:
the true situation and the problems that actually exist in life, in contrast to how you would like life to be
    Sự thực, thực tế, thực tại; sự vật có thực.
examples: The reality is that there is not enough money to pay for this project.
They seemed to have the perfect marriage but the reality was very different.

definition:
television shows that are based on real people (not actors) in real situations, presented as entertainment
    truyền hình thực tế

to refuse to obey rules or people in authority
    Chống đối.
examples: Jacob rebelled against his parents' plans for him and left school at the age of 16.
If you are too strict with teenagers, they often rebel.

definition:
unwilling to obey rules or accept normal standards of behaviour, dress, etc
    Chống đối, hay chống đối.
    Bất trị, khó trị
examples: rebellious teenagers
Her teachers regard her as a rebellious, trouble-making girl.

definition:
to remember something
    [synonym] recollect
    Nhớ, nhớ lại
examples: She could not recall his name
If I recall correctly, he lives in Luton.
"As I recall," he said with some irritation, "you still owe me €150

definition:
to repeat the main points of an explanation or description
    Tóm lại, tóm tắt lại
examples: Finally, the teacher recapped the main points of the lesson.
To recap, our main aim is to increase sales by 15 percent this year.

definition:
that happened or began only a short time ago
    Gần đây, xảy ra gần đây, mới đây, mới xảy ra
examples: a recent development/discovery/event
his most recent visit to Poland
There have been many changes in recent years.

definition:
a person who works in a place such as a hotel, office, or hospital, who welcomes and helps visitors and answers the phone
    người tiếp tân, người lễ tân

(of a battery) that can be filled again with electrical power
    Có thể nạp lại
examples: rechargeable batteries

definition:
doing something dangerous and not worrying about the risks and the possible results
    Thiếu thận trọng, khinh suất, liều lĩnh, táo bạo
examples: He was found guilty of reckless driving
He had always been reckless with money.

definition:
behaviour that shows a lack of care about danger and the possible results of your actions
    Tính không lo lắng, tính không để ý tới; tính coi thường
    Tính thiếu thận trọng, tính khinh suất, tính liều lĩnh, tính táo bạo.
examples: He was full of boyish recklessness and irresponsibility.

definition:
the act of accepting that something exists, is true or is official
    Sự công nhận, sự thừa nhận
examples: a growing recognition that older people have potential too

definition:
the ability to remember something; the act of remembering something
    [synonym] memory
    những kỷ niệm, những điều nhớ lại; hồi ký
    Sự nhớ lại, sự hồi tưởng lại; ký ức, hồi ức.
examples: I have many pleasant recollections of the time we spent together
His powers of recollection are extraordinary.

definition:
advice telling someone what the best thing to do is
    Sự giới thiệu, sự tiến cử.
    Sự khuyên nhủ, sự dặn bảo.
examples: We chose the hotel on their recommendation (= because they recommended it)

definition:
to build or make something again that has been damaged or that no longer exists
    Xây dựng lại, kiến thiết lại
examples: Old London Bridge was bought by an American and reconstructed in the US.
They have tried to reconstruct the settlement as it would have been in Iron Age times.

definition:
to describe how something happened, or to tell a story
    Thuật kỹ lại, kể lại chi tiết
examples: He recounted his adventures since he had left home.
He was fond of recounting how he had played professional football when he was 19.

definition:
to become completely well again after an illness or injury
    to become successful or normal again after being damaged or having problems
    hồi phục, bình phục, trở lại bình thường
examples: It took her a long time to recover from/after her heart operation
It took a long time for the economy to recover after the slump.

definition:
(a way of) enjoying yourself when you are not working
    Sự giải lao, sự giải trí, sự tiêu khiển.
examples: His recreations include golf, football and shooting.
Emma's only form of recreation seems to be shopping.

definition:
connected with activities that people do for enjoyment when they are not working
    (Thuộc) Sự giải trí, (thuộc) sự tiêu khiển; có tính chất giải trí, có tính chất tiêu khiển.
examples: recreational activities/facilities
These areas are set aside for public recreational use.

definition:
able to be recycled
    có thể tái chế được
examples: Glass products are completely recyclable.
Paper is easily recyclable.

definition:
an act of making something less or smaller; the state of being made less or smaller
    Sự thu nhỏ, sự giảm bớt
examples: a 33% reduction in the number of hospital beds available
The report recommends further reductions in air and noise emissions.

definition:
unnecessary because it isnot needed or useful
    Thừa, dư
examples: There’s a lot of redundant information that you could cut out here
The picture has too much redundant detail.

definition:
to mention or speak about somebody/something
    Ám chỉ, nói đến, kể đến, nhắc đến
examples: You know who I'm referring to.
She always referred to Ben as ‘that nice man’.
The victims were not referred to by name.
I promised not to refer to the matter again.

definition:
a mention of something
    Sự ám chỉ, sự nói đến, sự nhắc đến
examples: Knowing what had happened, I avoided making any reference to (= mentioning) weddings
He made several references to his time in France.

definition:
to show the image of somebody/something on the surface of something such as a mirror, water or glass
    Phản chiếu, phản xạ, dội lại
    Phản ánh.
examples: His face was reflected in the mirror.
She could see herself reflected in his eyes.

definition:
careful thought about something, sometimes over a long period of time
    Sự suy nghĩ, sự ngẫm nghĩ; snh những ý nghĩ
examples: She decided on reflection to accept his offer after all.
A week off would give him time for reflection.

definition:
to improve a system, an organization, a law, etc
    by making changes to it
    Cải cách, cải thiện, cải tạo, cải tổ
examples: Who will reform our unfair electoral system?
He was credited with having reformed the education system.

definition:
waste material that has been thrown away
    [synonym] rubbish
    Đồ thừa, đồ thải, đồ bỏ đi; rác rưởi
examples: domestic/household refuse
the city refuse dump
refuse collection/disposal

definition:
following a pattern, especially with the same time or space in between each thing and the next
    Đều đều, không thay đổi; thường lệ.
examples: Her heartbeat was regular.
The gardeners planted the trees at regular intervals.
I suggest that we have regular meetings/meet on a regular basis.

definition:
an official rule made by a government or some other authority
    Điều quy định, quy tắc, điều lệ
examples: Under the new regulations spending on office equipment will be strictly controlled.
the strict regulations governing the sale of weapons

definition:
(formal) to give a spoken or written report of something; to tell a story
    Kể lại, thuật lại
examples: She relates her childhood experiences in the first chapters
The story relates that an angel appeared and told him to sing.

definition:
a person who is in the same family as somebody else (= relative)
    Người bà con, họ hàng, thân thuộc
examples: a close/near/distant relation of mine
a relation by marriage
a party for friends and relations
He's called Brady too, but we're no relation (= not related).

definition:
the way in which two or more things are connected
    Mối quan hệ, mối liên hệ.
examples: a father-son relationship
I'm not sure of the exact relationship between them—I think they're cousins.

definition:
a person who is in the same family as somebody else
    [synonym] relation
    Bà con thân thuộc, người có họ.
examples: I don't have many blood relatives (= people related to me by birth rather than by marriage)
All her close/distant relatives came to the wedding.

definition:
to allow a substance to flow out from somewhere
    (Hoá học) Làm bay ra, làm thoát ra (hơi)
examples: Coal power stations release sulphur dioxide into the atmosphere.
Hormones are released from glands into the bloodstream.

definition:
to put someone or something into a lower or less important rank or position
    Loại bỏ, bỏ xó, bỏ riêng ra
    Đẩy xuống vị trí thấp hơn, ít quan trọng hơn.
examples: She resigned when she was relegated to a desk job.
The story was relegated to the middle pages of the paper.

definition:
connected with what is happening or being discussed
    Thích đáng, thích hợp; xác đáng.
examples: Education should be relevant to the child's needs
Send me all the relevant information.

definition:
needing somebody/something in order to survive, be successful, etc.
    [synonym] dependenton/upon something
    dựa chủ yếu vào, phụ thuộc vào
examples: Businesses have become increasingly reliant on complicated computing systems.
The service has become heavily reliant on government support.

definition:
the belief in and worship of a god or gods, or any such system of belief and worship
    Tôn giáo, đạo; tín ngưỡng
examples: the Christian religion

definition:
to still be present after the other parts have been removed, used, etc
    ; to continue to exist
    Còn lại
examples: Very little of the house remained after the fire.
Only about half of the original workforce remains.
There were only ten minutes remaining.

definition:
a successful way of curing an illness
    Thuốc, phương thuốc; cách điều trị
examples: an effective herbal remedy for headaches
an excellent home remedy for sore throats

definition:
to think, talk or write about a happy time in your past
    Hồi tưởng, nhớ lại, ôn lại.
examples: We spent a happy evening reminiscing about the past

definition:
far away from places where other people live
    [synonym] isolated
    xa xôi, hẻo lánh
examples: a remote beach
one of the remotest areas of the world

definition:
a piece of equipment that you hold in your hand and use to control a television, DVD player, etc
    cái điều khiển từ xa
examples: Have you seen the remote control for the TV anywhere?

definition:
]
    (formal) to cause somebody/something to be in a particular state or condition
    [synonym] make
    khiến cho thứ gì đó trở nên
examples: to render something harmless/useless/ineffective
Hundreds of people were rendered homeless by the earthquake.
His rudeness rendered me speechless
New technology has rendered my old computer obsolete.

definition:
(of energy and natural resources) that is replaced naturally or controlled carefully and can therefore be used without the risk of finishing it all
    (năng lượng) có thể hồi phục lại, có thể tái tạo lại
examples: renewable sources of energy such as wind and solar power

definition:
to repair and improve something, especially a building
    Làm mới lại, đổi mới; cải tiến, sửa chữa lại.
    (Kiến trúc) Sửa sang.
examples: the newly renovated church
They spent the summer renovating a farmhouse in Kent.
He renovates old houses and sells them at a profit.

definition:
that can be repaired
    [opposite] irreparable
    Có thể sửa chữa, có thể tu sửa

an indirect and usually bad result of an action or event that may happen some time afterwards
    [synonym] consequence
    (Nghĩa bóng) Tác động trở lại; hậu quả
    (Nghĩa đen) Sự dội lại (âm thanh); âm vang, tiếng vọng.
examples: The collapse of the company will have repercussions for the whole industry
Any decrease in tourism could have serious repercussions for the local economy
President Kennedy's assassination had far-reaching repercussions.

definition:
to be a sign or symbol of something:
    Miêu tả, hình dung, thể hiện
examples: To many people the White House represents the identity of the United States

definition:
the way that someone or something is shown or described
    a sign, picture, model, etc
    of something
    Sự miêu tả, sự hình dung
examples: He gave a talk on the representation of women in 19th-century art.
This statue is a representation of Hercules.

definition:
a person who has been chosen to speak or vote for somebody else or on behalf of a group
    Người đại biểu, người đại diện.
examples: a representative of the UN
The committee includes representatives from industry.

definition:
any animal that has cold blood and skin covered in scales, and that lays eggs
    (Động vật học) Loài bò sát
examples: Snakes, crocodiles and tortoises are all reptiles
There was a fashion for keeping reptiles as pets.

definition:
the opinion that people have about what somebody/something is like, based on what has happened in the past
    Tiếng (xấu, tốt
    )
    Thanh danh, danh tiếng.
examples: The company has a worldwide reputation for quality.
She has the reputation of being a good doctor.
His reputation was destroyed when he was caught stealing some money
The hotel has a bad/good reputation.

definition:
to study something carefully and try to discover new facts about it
    Nghiên cứu.
examples: They're researching into ways of improving people's diet

definition:
the fact of being or looking similar to somebody/something
    [synonym] likeness
    Sự giống nhau.
examples: a striking/close/strong resemblance
family resemblances
resemblance to somebody/something She bears an uncanny resemblance to Dido.
The movie bears little resemblance to the original novel.

definition:
to feel bitter or angry about something, especially because you feel it is unfair
    Phẫn uất, oán giận
    Phật ý, không bằng lòng, bực bội.
examples: I deeply resented her criticism.
The children resented the new woman in their father’s life.
He bitterly resents being treated like a child.
She resented him making all the decisions.

definition:
a feeling of doubt about a plan or an idea
    sự hoài nghi, sự ngờ vực, sự không chắc chắn
examples: I have serious reservations about his ability to do the job.
Workers and employees shared deep reservations about the wisdom of the government's plans for the industry
He accepted my advice without reservation.

definition:
to ask for a seat, table, room, etc
    to be available for you or somebody else at a future time
    [synonym] book
    Dành trước, giữ trước
examples: I'd like to reserve a table for three for eight o'clock.
I've reserved a room in the name of Jones.

definition:
officially staying or living somewhere
    ở, cư trú, trú ngụ
examples: The Queen is in residence at the Palace this week
The flag flies when the Queen is in residence.

definition:
to refuse to accept something and try to stop it from happening
    [synonym] oppose
    Kháng cự, chống lại
    Chịu đựng được, chịu được.
    Cưỡng lại, không mắc phải.
examples: to resist change
I found the temptation to miss the class too hard to resist.
Eric couldn’t resist a smile when she finally agreed.

definition:
not affected by something; able to resist something
    Chống cự, kháng cự, đề kháng.
    Có sức chịu đựng, có sức bền, bền.
examples: plants that are resistant to disease
Mosquitoes are becoming resistant to insecticides.

definition:
the act of [resolving] or ending a problem or difficulty
    Sự giải quyết (vấn đề, mối nghi ngờ)
examples: a successful resolution to the crisis
The government is pressing for an early resolution of the dispute.
Have you resolved the problem of transport yet?
The couple resolved their differences and made an effort to get along.

definition:
to say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done
    Phản ứng lại.
    Đáp lại, hưởng ứng (lời kêu gọi, sự đối xử tốt
    ).
examples: To every question, he responded "I don't know
I asked her what the time was, but she didn't respond.
He responded by marching off and slamming the door behind him.

definition:
to limit the size, amount or range of something
    Hạn chế, giới hạn, thu hẹp
examples: Speed is restricted to 30 mph in towns.
We restrict the number of students per class to 10.
Fog severely restricted visibility
Having small children tends to restrict your freedom.

definition:
the activity of selling goods to the public, usually in shops
    Bán lẻ
examples: The job is open to applicants with over two years' experience in retail.
The clothing company has six retail outlets (= shops) in Perth.
$13 off the manufacturer's recommended retail price

definition:
to keep something; to continue to have something
    [synonym] preserve
    duy trì, lưu giữ
examples: The sea retains the sun's warmth longer than the land

definition:
to stop doing your job, especially because you have reached a particular age or because you are ill/sick; to tell somebody they must stop doing their job
    Thôi việc; về hưu
examples: My dream is to retire to a villa in France.
He is retiring next year after 30 years with the company.
The company's official retiring age is 65.
At 60, he was now approaching retirement.
Susan is going to take early retirement (= retire before the usual age).

definition:
to pull something back or in
    Rụt vào, thụt vào, co vào
examples: The wheels retract after the aircraft takes off.
The cat retracted its claws.

definition:
to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret
    hé lộ, tiết lộ (bí mật)
examples: Her biography revealed that she was not as rich as everyone thought
He would not reveal where he had hidden her chocolate eggs.

definition:
produce a new growth of vegetation on (disturbed or barren ground)
    Lại mọc lại, lại sinh trưởng (cây)
    Lại trồng lại, tái phủ xanh (đồi trọc, đất cằn)
examples: each spring we revegetate acre after acre with pine seedlings
His wife divorced him after the revelation that he was having an affair.
Shocking revelations about their private life appeared in the papers.

definition:
to change something completely so that it is the opposite of what it was before
    Đảo ngược, lộn ngược, lật ngượclại
examples: The new manager hoped to reverse the decline in the company's fortunes.
Now that you have a job and I don't, our situations are reversed.

definition: có thể đảo ngược được, có thể làm cho trở lại như cũ được
examples: He believes that climate change may still be reversible.
The surgery is not reversible.

definition: to look again at something you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam
examples: We will be reviewing all the topics covered this semester.

definition:
UK (US review) to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam
    (xem lại, đọc lại sách hoặc vở, đặc biệt là để ôn tập)
examples: I spent the weekend revising for my exam.
I can't come out tonight
I have to revise.

definition:
one complete circular movement of something, for example a wheel
    Vòng, tua
examples: the revolution of the earth around the sun

definition:
to completely change the way that something is done
    Cách mạng hoá
    Tạo ra những bước đột phá
    Tạo ra những thay đổi mang tính cách mạng
examples: Aerial photography has revolutionized the study of archaeology
Newton's discoveries revolutionized physics.
The earth revolves around the sun.
The gun turret revolved until the gun was aimed at the advancing soldiers.
a rewarding experience/job

definition:
a very large, thick-skinned animal from Africa or Asia that has one or two horns on its nose
    (Động vật học) Con tê giác
examples: a population of black/white rhinoceros

definition:
a strong regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements
    Nhịp điệu (trong thơ nhạc).
    Sự nhịp nhàng (của động tác
    ).
examples: to dance to the rhythm of the music
music with a fast/slow/steady rhythm
jazz rhythms

definition:
having a regular pattern of sounds, movements or events
    Có nhịp điệu.
    Nhịp nhàng.
examples: music with a fast, rhythmic beat

the rhythmic ticking of the clock

definition:
very silly or unreasonable
    [synonym] absurd, ludicrous
    Buồn cười, tức cười, lố bịch, lố lăng
examples: I look ridiculous in this hat.
