definition:
the possibility of something bad happening
    (sự rủi ro, sự nguy hiểm)
examples: There is still a risk that the whole deal will fall through

pronunciationString: risk-taker
definition:
someone who often takes risks
    (người hay chơi liều, hay chấp nhận rủi ro để thắng lớn)
examples: They are risk-takers who either make a lot of money or lose a lot.

definition:
a state in which two people, companies, etc
    are competing for the same thing
    Sự cạnh tranh, sự kình địch, sự ganh đua, sự tranh tài, sự đua tài.
examples: sibling rivalry (= between brothers and sisters)
rivalry (with somebody/something) (for something) a fierce rivalry for world supremacy
rivalry (between A and B) (for something) There is a certain amount of friendly rivalry between the teams.
political rivalries

definition:
the science of designing and operating robots
    Người máy học; khoa nghiên cứu việc sử dụng người máy (trong (công nghiệp) chế tạo).

any of various small mammals with large, sharp front teeth, such as mice and rats

the part of a plant that grows down into the earth to get water and food and holds the plant firm in the ground
    Rễ (cây)

definition:
likely to be good or successful
    [synonym] hopeful

definition:

definition:
the action of an object moving in a circle around a central fixed point

definition:
the process of learning something by repeating it until you remember it, rather than by understanding the meaning of it

definition:
the normal order and way in which you regularly do things
    Lề thói hằng ngày; công việc thường làm hằng ngày.

pronunciationString: run off
definition:
(of a liquid) to flow out of a container

definition:

    Vội vã đi gấp.

definition:
the time, usually twice a day, when the roads are full of traffic and trains are crowded because people are travelling to or from work

definition:

definition:
money that employees receive for doing their job, especially professional employees or people working in an office, usually paid every month
    Tiền mà nhân viên nhận được để làm công việc của họ, đặc biệt là nhân viên chuyên nghiệp hoặc những người làm việc trong văn phòng, thường được trả trực tiếp vào tài khoản ngân hàng của họ mỗi tháng
examples: an annual salary of $40 000
a 9% salary increase

definition:
the liquid produced in your mouth to keep the mouth wet and to help to prepare food to be digested

to save goods from damage or destruction, especially from a ship that has sunk or been damaged or a building that has been damaged by fire or a flood

definition:

definition:

pronunciationString: save up

definition:
one of the many very small, flat pieces that cover the skin of fish, snakes, etc

definition: Khan hiếm, ít có, thiếu, khó tìm

definition:

definition:

definition:

o introduce/operate a scheme to improve links between schools and industryUnder the new scheme only successful schools will be given extra funding.

definition:

definition: Khoa học

relating to science, or using the organized methods of science

definition:

definition:

definition:

definition:
that is not being used or is not needed at the present time
    Thừa, dư, có để dành.
    Để thay thế (đồ phụ tùng).
examples: a spare key/tyre
We have a spare room if you want to stay overnight with us.

definition:
a particular area of knowledge or the process of becoming an expert in a particular area
    Sự chuyên môn hoá, sự chuyên khoa.
examples: Specialization (= limiting study or work to one particular area) usually doesn't occur until PhD level.
The lawyer said that he was unable to help us because our case fell outside his specialization.

definition:
a set of animals or plants in which the members have similar characteristics to each other and can breed with each other
    (Sinh vật học) Loài
examples: Mountain gorillas are an endangered species.
Over a hundred species of insect are found in this area.

definition:
very exciting to look at
    đẹp mắt, ngoạn mục
examples: a spectacular view
He scored a spectacular goal in the second half.
There was a spectacular sunset last night.

definition:
to guess possible answers to a question when you do not have enough information to be certain
    Suy đoán, đưa ra ý kiến này ý kiến nọ về, ước đoán
examples: I don't know why she did it - I'm just speculating
The newspapers have speculated that they will get married next year.

definition:
the activity of guessing possible answers to a question without having enough information to be certain
    Sự suy đoán, sự ước đoán
examples: Rumours that they are about to marry have been dismissed as pure speculation.
News of the president's illness fuelled/prompted speculation that an election will be held later in the year.

definition:
(especially of liquid) to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this
    làm tràn, làm đổ, đánh đổ (chất lỏng)
examples: Water had spilled out of the bucket onto the floor.
He startled her and made her spill her drink.

definition:
happening or done in a natural, often sudden way, without any planning or being forced
    Tự động, tự ý
    Tự phát, tự sinh.
examples: We spontaneously started to dance

definition:
a piece of curved or bent metal that can be pressed into a smaller space but then returns to its usual shape
    Lò xo
examples: bed springsThe springs in the sofa have gone (= they no longer return to their original position)
She's full of energy, like a coiled spring.

definition:
to make a short high sound that is not very loud
    Tiếng rúc rích, tiếng chít chít (chuột).
    Tiếng cọt kẹt, tiếng cót két.
examples: My new shoes squeak.
The mouse ran away, squeaking with fear.
One wheel makes a horrible squeaking noise.

definition:
firmly fixed; not likely to move, change or fail
    [synonym] steady
    Cân bằng, vững vàng, ổn định
    (người) Kiên định, kiên quyết.
examples: stable prices
a stable relationship
This ladder doesn't seem very stable.
The patient's condition is stable (= it is not getting worse).

definition:
a large sports ground surrounded by rows of seats and usually other buildings
    sân vận động
examples: Thousands of fans packed into the stadium to watch the match.
the opening of a new national stadium (= where a country's team plays its home games)

definition:
all the workers employed in an organization considered as a group
    Toàn thể cán bộ nhân viên giúp việc, biên chế; bộ phận
examples: teaching staff
We have 20 part-time members of staff.

definition:
a part of an activity or a period of development
    Giai đoạn.
examples: The project is in its final stages and should be completed by August.

definition:
so great, shocking or surprising that it is difficult to believe
    [synonym] astounding
    đáng kinh ngạc, gây sốc
examples: They paid a staggering £5 million for the house
It costs a staggering $50,000 per week to keep the museum open to the public.

definition:
a set of stairs inside a building, usually with a bar fixed on the wall or onto vertical poles at the side for you to hold on to
    Cầu thang
examples: a marble/stone/wooden staircase
She descended the sweeping (= long and wide) staircase into the crowd of photographers and journalists.

definition:
average or normal rather than having special or unusual features
    Tiêu chuẩn, chuẩn, mẫu
examples: Televisions are a standard feature in most hotel rooms
White is the standard colour for this model of refrigerator.

definition: the amount of money and comfort people have in a particular society
examples: The standard of living in many developing countries is low.

definition:
a very large ball of burning gas in space that is usually seen from the earth as a point of light in the sky at night
    Sao, ngôi sao, tinh tú
examples: Stars twinkled above them as they lay on the hill
We could see hundreds of stars in the clear desert sky.

definition:
very different to something in a way that is easy to see
    [synonym] clear
    (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Lộ rõ hẳn ra, nổi bật ra
examples: the differences between rural and urban areaare very stark.
The good weather was in stark contrast to the storms of previous weeks.

definition:
to say or write something, especially clearly and carefully
    Phát biểu, nói rõ, tuyên bố
examples: Union members stated (that) they were unhappy with the proposal
Please state why you wish to apply for this grant.

definition:
using the most modern or advanced techniques or methods; as good as it can be at the present time
    tối tân, hiện đại
examples: The system was state of the art.
a state-of-the-art system
The Physics Department has state of the art facilities.

definition:
not moving; not intended to be moved
    Đứng ở một chỗ, không di chuyển, tĩnh lại, dừng
examples: I remained stationary
a stationary exercise bike
Some of the larger birds can remain stationary in the air for several minutes.

definition:
a collection of numerical facts or measurements, as about people, business conditions, or weather
    số liệu điều tra, số liệu thống kê
examples: The statistics show that, in general, women live longer than men.

definition:
an object made from a hard material, especially stone or metal, to look like a person or animal
    tượng
examples: a statue of a boy
They planned to put up/erect a statue to the president.

definition:
a strong metal that is a mixture of iron and carbon, used for making things that need a strong structure, especially vehicles and buildings
    thép
examples: The concrete is strengthened with steel rods
The gates were locked with a padlock and a heavy steel chain.

definition:
(of a slope) rising or falling at a sharp angle
    dốc
examples: a steep slope
It's a steep climb to the top of the mountain, but the view is worth it.
The castle is set on a steep hill/hillside.

definition:
(specialist) connected with the stars
    (Thuộc) Sao, (thuộc) tinh tú
examples: a stellar explosion
stellar light

definition:
to continue doing something despite difficulties
    to continue doing or using something and not want to change it
    Kiên trì, bám vào (cái gì)
examples: She finds it impossible to stick to a diet
He promised to help us and he stuck to his word (= he did as he had promised)
‘Shall we meet on Friday this week?’ ‘No, let's stick to Saturday

definition:
to encourage something to grow, develop, or become active
    Kích thích, khuyến khích.
examples: Good teachers should ask questions that stimulate students to think

definition:
full of interesting or exciting ideas; making people feel enthusiastic
    [synonym] inspiring
    Kích thích, khuyến khích
examples: The college offers a challenging and stimulating environment in which to study.
a stimulating discussionThe classes look attractive and stimulating.

definition:
something that produces a reaction in a human, an animal or a plant
    Sự kích thích; tác dụng kích khích
examples: sensory/verbal/visual stimuli
The animals were conditioned to respond to auditory stimuli (= sounds).

definition:
the hard, solid substance found in the ground that is often used for building, or a piece of this
    Đá, hòn đá, cục đá
examples: Most of the houses are built of stone.
stone walls
a stone floor
a flight of stone steps

definition:
the process of putting and keeping of things in a special place for use in the future
    Sự xếp vào kho.
    Kho; khu vực kho.
examples: We've had to build some cupboards to give us more storage space
tables that fold flat for storage

definition:
to keep information or facts in a computer or in your brain
    lưu trữ (thông tin)
examples: Thousands of pieces of data are stored in a computer's memory

definition:
a level of a building; a floor
    Tầng, tầng gác.
examples: (especially US English story)
a three-storey houseTheir new house has four storeys including the attic

definition:
the art of telling stories
    nghệ thuật kể chuyện
examples: The celebration will include dance, song, and storytelling
She has a gift for storytelling
storytelling sessions
Just follow the signs to Bradford - it's very straightforward
It's quite straightforward to get here.

definition:
pressure on somebody/something because they have too much to do or manage, or something very difficult to deal with
    the problems, worry or anxiety that this produces
    gánh nặng, sự căng thẳng, áp lực lớn
examples: These repayments are putting a strain on our finances
The transport service cannot cope with the strain of so many additional passengers.

definition:
a plan that is intended to achieve a particular purpose
    Chiến lược
    Kế hoạch.
examples: to develop a strategy for dealing with unemployment
It's all part of an overall strategy to gain promotion.

definition:
a continuous area of land or water
    quãng (đường); dải, khoảng (đất)
examples: This particular stretch of coast is especially popular with hikers.
Traffic is at a standstill along a five-mile stretch of the ring-road.
Some very rare birds inhabit our stretch of the river.

definition:
[of rules, regulations]that must be obeyed exactly
    Nghiêm ngặt, nghiêm khắc; nghiêm chỉnh
examples: strict rules/regulations/discipline
There are strict guidelines on how the work is to be carried out.
She's on a very strict diet.
My parents were very strict with me when I was young

definition:
very unusual or easily noticed, and therefore attracting a lot of attentio
    Nổi bật, gây ấn tượng sâu sắc, đập vào mắt
examples: She bears a striking resemblance to her mother.
There's a striking contrast between what he does and what he says he does.

definition:
Enjoy studying or spend a lot of time studying
    (chăm học, siêng học)
examples: She was a studious child, happiest when reading

definition:
to have difficulty speaking because you cannot stop yourself from repeating the first sound of some words several times
    Nói lắp
examples: ‘W-w-what?’ he stuttered
She stutters a little, so be patient and let her finish what she's saying.

definition:
happening or coming after something else
    [opposite] previous
    Đến sau, theo sau, xảy ra sau
examples: The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics.
Those explosions must have been subsequent to our departure, because we didn't hear anything.

definition:
afterwards; later; after something else has happened
    Rồi thì, rồi sau đó.
examples: The original interview notes were subsequently lost.
Subsequently, new guidelines were issued to all employees.
He subsequently became chairman of the party.

definition:
a type of solid, liquid or gas that has particular qualities
    Chất, vật chất
examples: a chemical/radioactive, etc
substance
banned/illegal substances (= drugs)
a sticky substance

definition:
happening one after another
    kế tiếp; liên tiếp
examples: She had her first three children in rapid succession
This is the seventh year in succession that they've won the tournament.

definition:
to experience physical or mental pain
    Chịu, bị.
examples: He suffered a massive heart attack

definition:
enough for a particular purpose; as much as you need
    Đủ
examples: Allow sufficient time to get there
Our budget is hardly sufficient to pay people, let alone buy any new equipment.

definition:
the act of killing yourself intentionally, or a person who has done this
    Sự tự sát, sự tự tử, sự tự vẫn.
examples: The suicide rate among men between the ages of 16 and 25 has risen alarmingly

definition:
to give a summary of something (= a statement of the main points)
    Tóm tắt, tổng kết
examples: The results of the research are summarized at the end of the chapter

definition:
luxurious and showing that you are rich
    Xa hoa, xa xỉ.
    Lộng lẫy.
examples: a sumptuous meal
We dined in sumptuous surroundings.
The celebrity guests turned up dressed in sumptuous evening gowns.

definition:
the star that provides light and heat for the earth and around which the earth moves
    Mặt trời, vừng thái dương.
    Ánh nắng, ánh mặt trời.
examples: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
The sun's rays are at their most powerful at midday.
We thought we'd go out for a walk while the sun was shining.

definition:
excellent; of very good quality
    tuyệt vời, tuyệt hảo, hoàn mỹ
examples: The car's in superb condition.
His performance was absolutely superb.

definition:
(often disapproving) not studying or looking at something thoroughly; seeing only what is obvious
    Nông cạn, hời hợt, thiển cận
examples: I thought that article was written at a very superficial level
The documentary's treatment/analysis of the issues was very superficial
I only have a superficial (= slight) knowledge of French.

definition:
an amount of something that is provided or available to be used
    nguồn cung, nguồn dự trữ, nguồn có sẵn
examples: The water supply is unsafe.
Supplies of food are almost exhausted.

definition:
to hold something firmly or carry its weight, especially from below to stop it from falling
    Chống, đỡ
examples: The church dome is supported by/on marble pillars.
My ankle is weak, so I always put a bandage on it to support it when I play tennis.

definition:
to think that something is likely to be true
    cho rằng, tin, nghĩ rằng
examples: Getting a visa isn't as simple as you might suppose.
Prices will go up, I suppose.

definition:
large waves in the sea or ocean, and the white foam that they produce as they fall on the beach, on rocks, etc
    sóng nhào
examples: the sound of surf breaking on the beach
Sydney, surf capital of the world (= where the sport of surfing is very popular)

definition:
the outside or top layer of something
    Mặt, mặt ngoài, bề mặt
examples: an uneven road surface
We'll need a flat surface to play the game on.
a broad leaf with a large surface area

definition:
the sport of riding on a wave on a special board
    môn lướt sóng
examples: to go surfing

definition:
to do or be better than somebody/something
    Hơn, vượt, trội hơn, vượt qua, vượt mặt
examples: His time for the 100 metres surpassed the previous world record by one hundredth of a second
The book's success has surpassed everyone's expectations
The director has really surpassed himself (= done better than he has done before) with this new film.

definition:
to be everywhere around something
    Bao quanh, vây quanh
examples: Snow-capped mountains surround the city.
Gwen sat at her desk, surrounded by books and papers.

definition:
to have an idea that something is probably true or likely to happen, especially something bad, but without having definite proof
    Nghi, ngờ, nghi ngờ, hoài nghi
examples: If you suspect a gas leak, do not strike a match or even turn on an electric light.
Suspecting nothing, he walked right into the trap.

definition:
to cause or allow something to continue for a period of time
    to keep alive
    giữ cho ai đó/thứ gì đó sống, cung cấp đủ điều kiện sống/hoạt động cho thứ gì đó
examples: Which planets can sustain life?
The soil in this part of the world is not rich enough to sustain a large population.

definition:
that can continue or be continued for a long time
    có thể duy trì lâu dài được, có thể phát triển lâu bền được
examples: sustainable economic growth
That sort of extreme diet is not sustainable over a long period.

definition:
the act of usingrude or offensive language, especially when angry
    tội nói tục, chửi thề

a pink vegetable that looks like a potato and has yellow or white flesh and a sweet taste
    khoai lang

a change from one thing to another, especially when this is sudden and complete
    chuyển hẳn sang cái gì đó
examples: a switch of priorities
She made the switch from full-time to part-time work when her first child was born.

definition:
(a plan showing) the subjects or books to be studied in a particular course
    Đề cương bài giảng; đề cương khoá học
    Kế hoạch học tập.
examples: Which books are on the syllabus this year?

definition:
artificial; made by combining chemical substances rather than being produced naturally by plants or animals
    synonym man-made
    Giả tạo, nhân tạo
    Tổng hợp, hoá hợp.
examples: synthetic drugs/fabrics
synthetic dyes

definition:
newspapers have small pages and short articles with a lot of pictures and stories about famous people, and are often thought of as less serious than other newspapers
    (nghĩa đen) báo khổ nhỏ
    (nghĩa bóng) báo chí lá cải, chỉ chuyên đưa tin giật gân, tin về đời tư người nổi tiếng
examples: a tabloid newspaper
the tabloid press
tabloid journalists

definition:
to try to deal with something or someone
    Xử trí, tìm cách giải quyết (một vấn đề, một công việc)
examples: There are many ways of tackling this problem.
The government is determined to tackle inflation.

pronunciationString: take off
examples: The plane took off at 8
m

definition:
an act of taking control of a company by buying most of its shares
    thương vụ mua lại một công ty khác
examples: They were involved in a takeover last year

definition:
a sharp nail on the foot of a bird that it uses when hunting animals
    Móng, vuốt (chim mồi)

to make a wild animaleasy to control
    Dạy cho thuần, thuần hoá; làm cho không sợ người, làm cho dạn
examples: Lions can never be completely tamed
Tiger is hard to tame — hổ khó dạy cho thuần

definition:
a ship or lorry/truck that carries oil, gas or petrol/gas in large quantities
    Tàu chở dầu, xe tải chở dầu/gas
examples: an oil tanker

definition:
a sudden period of uncontrolled anger like a young child's
    Cơn giận, cơn thịnh nộ, cơn tam bành; ăn vạ (trẻ con)
examples: to have/throw a tantrum
Children often have temper tantrums at the age of two or thereabouts.

definition:
needing a great amount of physical or mental effort
    [synonym] demanding
    Gây mệt mỏi; đòi hỏi cố gắng
examples: a taxing job
This shouldn't be too taxing for you.
There was nothing intellectually taxing about the exercise.

definition:
a person who is between 13 and 19 years old
    Thiếu niên, thiếu nữ.
examples: a magazine aimed at teenagers

definition:
a method of sending messages over long distances, using wires that carry electrical signals
    điện báo
examples: The news came by telegraph
telegraph wires

definition:
the part of your character that affects your moods and the way you behave
    Khí chất, tính khí, tính.
examples: a fiery temperament

definition:
to be attracted by somebody or something, even if you know it is wrong
    Cám dỗ, quyến rũ, nhử, làm thèm, gợi thèm.
    Xúi, xúi giục.
examples: I was tempted by the dessert menu.
Don't tempt thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.
I was tempted to take the day off.

definition:
to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic
    Có khuynh hướng.
examples: Women tend to live longer than men

definition:
a feeling of anxiety and stress that makes it impossible to relax
    stress, lo lắng
examples: You could feel the tension in the room as we waited for our exam results

definition:
to end; to make something end
    Xong, kết thúc, chấm dứt, kết cục, kết liễu
examples: Your contract of employment terminates in December.
The agreement was terminated immediately.

definition:
relating to the Earth
    (Thuộc) Đất, (thuộc) trái đất.
    Ở trên mặt đất, ở thế gian.
examples: a terrestrial habitat
terrestrial life

definition:
(informal) excellent; wonderful
    tốt, tuyệt vời
examples: I feel absolutely terrific today!
That’s terrific news!

definition:
(of a building) having the roof covered with straw or reeds
    Có mái rạ, có mái tranh, có mái lá; lợp tranh, lợp rạ, lợp lá
examples: They live in an idyllic country/thatched cottage, with roses around the door

definition:
the person who is on trial in a law court
    Bị cáo
examples: The accused protested her innocence.
The accused were all found guilty

pronunciationString: the cost of living
definition:
the amount of money you need in order to pay for basic things such as food, clothes, shelter, heating, and transport
    (chi phí sinh hoạt)

the ordinary people in society who are not leaders or who are considered to be not very well educated
    quảng đại quần chúng (đặc biệt là những người có trình độ học thức nói chung là không cao)
examples: government attempts to suppress dissatisfaction among the masses
a TV programme that brings science to the masses

definition:
the main ways that large numbers of people receive information and entertainment, that is television, radio, newspapers and the Internet
    Hệ thống truyền thông
examples: the local/national media
media attention/coverage/hype/reports
The issue has been much discussed in the media.

definition:
a large park where people go to enjoy themselves, for example by riding on large machines such as roller coasters, and where much of the entertainment is connected with one subject or idea
    công viên giải trí
examples: a western-style theme park

definition:
in a way that obeys some rules but is not likely
    Về mặt lý thuyết thì có thể, nhưng ít có khả năng hoạt động được trong thực tế
examples: It is theoretically possible

definition:
designed to help treat an illness
    (Y học) (thuộc) phép chữa bệnh
examples: the therapeutic properties of herbs

definition:
a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one that is done for a higher college or university degree
    Luận văn, luận án.
examples: Students must submit a thesis on an agreed subject within four years

definition:
a small, sharp pointed growth on the stem of a plant
    Gai

to be likely to cause harm or damage to something or someone
    Doạ, đe doạ, hăm doạ ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng)).
examples: A storm was threatening

definition:
a feeling of extreme excitement, usually caused by something pleasant
    Sự run lên, sự rộn lên, sự rộn ràng (vì sung sướng); sự rùng mình (kinh sợ)
examples: the thrill of winning a competition
It gave me a big thrill to meet my favourite author in person.
the thrill of catching a really big fish

definition:
(literary) a crowd of people
    Đám đông
examples: We pushed our way through the throng.
He was met by a throng of journalists and photographers.
A huge throng had gathered around the speaker.

definition:
a storm with thunder and lightning and usually very heavy rain
    Bão tố có sấm sét
examples: He slept well, unaware of the thunderstorms which filled the night.
The church was struck by lightning during a violent thunderstorm.

definition:
as a result of something just mentioned
    [synonym] hence, therefore
    Vì vậy, vì thế, vậy thì
examples: He is the eldest son and thus heir to the title.
We do not own the building
Thus, it would be impossible for us to make any major changes to it.

definition:
to make something look neat by putting things in the place where they belong
    làm cho sạch sẽ, dọn dẹp, sắp xếp gọn gàng, xếp sắp ngăn nắp
examples: I spent all morning cleaning and tidying.
When you cook, could you please tidy up after yourself.

definition:
[usually plural] a strong connection between people or organizations
    (Nghĩa bóng) Mối ràng buộc, quan hệ.
examples: family ties
the ties of friendship
economic ties
The firm has close ties with an American corporation.

definition:
a long heavy piece of wood used in building a house or ship
    trees that are grown to be used in building or for making things
    Cây gỗ
    Gỗ làm nhà, gỗ kiến trúc, gỗ.
examples: a timber forest
The house has exposed oak timbers.

definition:
taking or needing a lot of time
    Tốn nhiều thời gian, đòi hỏi nhiều thời gian, cần nhiều thời gian.
examples: a difficult and time-consuming process
It’s quite time-consuming having to check all the labels individually.

definition:
to have a feeling as if a lot of sharp points are being put quickly and lightly into your body
    Có cảm giác ngứa ran, ngứa như có kiến bò
    Bị kích động, bị kích thích, náo nức, rộn lên.
examples: My fingers and toes are tingling with the cold.
There's a line in that poem that makes my spine tingle every time I read it.
She tingled with fear as she entered the dark alleyway.

definition:
a child who has only recently learnt to walk
    Đứa bé đi chập chững.

things such as soap or toothpaste that you use for washing, cleaning your teeth, etc.
    Các vật dụng dùng khi tắm rửa (xà phòng, bàn chải )
examples: Inside the bag were shampoo and other toiletries.

definition:
able to accept what other people say or do even if you do not agree with it
    Khoan dung, hay tha thứ
    Kiên nhẫn.
examples: He has a very tolerant attitude towards other religions
These ants can tolerate temperatures that would kill other species
Few plants will tolerate sudden changes in temperature.
motorway tolls
a toll road/bridge

definition:
a pain in your teeth or in one tooth
    Đau răng
examples: I have terribletoothache

pronunciationString: tooth decay
definition:
Damage that occurs when germs (bacteria) in your mouth make acids that eat away at a tooth
    Sâu răng

a tall wooden pole that has symbols and pictures carved or painted on it, traditionally made by Native Americans
    Cột gỗ cao, khắc hoặc vẽ một loạt các biểu tượng vật tổ

demanding that particular rules be obeyed and showing a lack of sympathy for any problems or suffering that this may cause
    nghiêm khắc
examples: Don't be too tough on him—he was only trying to help.
It's about time teachers started to get tough with bullies.

definition:
to be much higher or taller than the people or things that are near
    Vượt hẳn lên, cao hơn
examples: The new hotel towers over the Shanghai skyline.
Although he's only twelve, Davidtowerd over his classmates.

definition:
extremely tall or high and therefore impressive
    Cao, cao ngất, cao vượt hẳn lên
examples: towering cliffs

definition:
to find someone or something that was lost
    to find the origin of something
    lần ra dấu vết, theo dấu
examples: The police are trying to trace the mother of a newborn baby found abandoned outside a hospital
The phone company was unable to trace the call
No one has yet been able to trace the source of the rumour.

definition:
the activity of buying and selling or of exchanging goods or services between people or countries
    Ngành buôn bán; những người trong ngành buôn bán
    Thương nghiệp, thương mại, sự buôn bán, mậu dịch.
examples: Trade between the two countries has increased.
the international trade in oil

definition:
a piece of business that is done between people, especially an act of buying or selling
    [synonym] deal
    Sự quản lý kinh doanh; công việc kinh doanh; sự giao dịch
examples: financial transactions between companies
commercial transactions

definition:
to go further, rise above, or be more important or better than something, especially a limit
    Vượt quá, hơn
examples: The best films are those which transcend national or cultural barriers.
The underlying message of the film is that love transcends everything else.
His works by far transcend anything that has gone before
What we felt for each other transcended all other emotions.

definition:
to change completely the appearance or character of something or someone, especially so that that thing or person is improved
    Thay đổi, biến đổi hoàn toàn
examples: A new colour scheme will transform your bedroom.
It was an event that would transform my life.

definition:
the process or a period of changing from one state or condition to another
    Sự chuyển tiếp, sự quá độ.
examples: the transition from school to full-time work
We need to ensure a smooth transition between the old system and the new one.

definition:
to change words into a different language
    dịch, phiên dịch
examples: Her books have been translated into 24 languages

definition:
something that is translated, or the process of translating something
    sự dịch; bản (bài) dịch
examples: Students will do one Spanish translation a week

definition:
a person who translates writing or speech into a different language
    người dịch, người phiên dịch, người thông dịch
examples: She works as a translator of technical texts.

definition: hiểm trở, nguy hiểm
examples: Snow and ice have left many roads treacherous, and drivers are warned to use caution

definition:
an exercise machine that has a moving surface that you can walk or run on while remaining in the same place
    máy chạy bộ
examples: I try to do half an hour’s exercise on the treadmill every morning

definition:
the use of drugs, exercises, etc
    to cure a person of an illness or injury
    (Y học) Sự điều trị; phép trị bệnh
examples: There are various treatments available for this condition.
Guests at the health spa receive a range of beauty treatments.

definition:
a general direction in which a situation is changing or developing
    khuynh hướng, xu hướng, chiều hướng
examples: There's been a downward/upward trend in sales in the last few years.
It's tricky to learn to ride a skateboard, but you never forget how.
I'm in a tricky situation - whatever I do I'll offend someone.

definition:
to make something happen suddenly, to cause something to start
    gây ra, gây nên.
examples: Nuts can trigger off a violent allergic reaction
to trigger an alarm

definition:
coming from, found in or typical of the tropics
    (Thuộc) Nhiệt đới
examples: tropical fish
tropical Africa
a tropical island

definition:
a low point in a regular series of high and low points
    điểm thấp
examples: Investing small amounts regularly is a good way of smoothing out the peaks and troughs of the stock market

definition:
the thick main stem of a tree
    Thân cây
examples: This tree trunk sounds hollow.
The biggest obstacle in our way was a tree trunk in the road.

definition:
a machine that uses hot air to dry clothes after they have been washed
    máy sấy quần áo

a type of machine through which liquid or gas flows and turns a special wheel with blades in order to produce power
    (Kỹ thuật) Tuabin, tuốc bin
examples: a steam turbine
a turbine engine

definition:
a state of great anxiety and confusion
    [synonym] confusion
    Sự náo động, sự rối loạn
examples: Her mind was in (a) turmoil.
The country is in a state of political turmoil.

definition:
a small very thin branch that grows out of a larger branch on a bush or tree
    Cành cây con, nhành cây
examples: We collected dry twigs to start the fire

definition:
a thick rubber ring that fits around the edge of a wheel of a car, bicycle, etc
    lốp xe
examples: a front tyrea back/rear tyreto pump up a tyrea flat/burst/punctured tyre

definition:
seeming to be everywhere or in several places at the same time; very common
    Ở đâu cũng có; hiện diện khắp mọi nơi
examples: Leather is very much in fashion this season, as is the ubiquitous denim.
The mobile phone, that most ubiquitous of consumer-electronic appliances, is about to enter a new age.

definition:
a secret purpose or reason for doing something
    (mục đích, động cơ, lý do) giấu kín, không nói ra
examples: He claims he just wants to help Lisa but I suspect he has an ulterior motive
She must have some ulterior motive for being nice to me—what does she really want?

definition:
in the end; finally
    Cuối cùng, sau cùng, sau rốt
examples: Ultimately, you'll have to make the decision yourself.
A poor diet will ultimately lead to illness.
The campaign was ultimately successful.

definition:
without being helped by anyone or anything
    Không được giúp đỡ.
examples: When will my baby stand unassisted?She decided on an unassisted birth at home
unassisted steering

definition:
impossible to achieve or reach
    Không thể tới được, không thể đạt được
examples: an unattainable goal
Setting unattainable goals will only lead to frustration.

definition:
able to judge fairly because you are not influenced by your own opinions
    [synonym] impartial
    Không thành kiến.
    Không thiên vị.
examples: unbiased advice
an unbiased judge
opposite biased

definition:
to discover something secret or hidden or remove something covering something else
    hé lộ, lật tẩy, khám phá ra
examples: Police have uncovered a plot to kidnap the President's son.

definition:
to make yourself responsible for something and start doing it
    Đảm nhiệm, nhận làm, cam kết, kiêm nhiệm
examples: Students are required to undertake simple experiments
University professors both teach and undertake research.

definition:
to find something in the ground by digging
    Đào lên, khai quật, bới ra
examples: Building at the site was halted after ancient artefacts were unearthed earlier this month
Police have unearthed a human skeleton.

definition:
not possible to do or achieve
    Không thể thực hành được, không thể thực hiện được, không thể làm được.
examples: The teachers’ demands were economically unfeasible.

definition: trở nên rõ ràng, trở nên được biết đến
examples: The audience watched as the story unfolded before their eyes.
Dramatic events were about to unfold.

definition:
used to say that something is sad, disappointing, or has a bad effect
    (+for sombody) Một cách đáng tiếc, không may
examples: Unfortunately, I didn't have my credit card with me, or else I would have bought it
Unfortunately for him, the police had been informed and were waiting outside.

definition:
not fit to live in; impossible to live in
    Không thể ở được, không trú ngụ được, không cư trú được
examples: The building was totally uninhabitable.
houses made uninhabitable by radioactive contamination

definition:
with no people living there
    Không có người ở, bỏ không
examples: an uninhabited island

They landed on an uninhabited island off the Newfoundland coast.

definition:
not done deliberately, but happening by accident
    Không cố ý, không chủ tâm
examples: Perhaps I misled you, but it was quite unintentional (= I did not mean to).
opposite intentional

definition:
existing everywhere or involving everyone
    Thuộc vũ trụ, thuộc thế giới, thuộc vạn vật
    Toàn bộ, toàn thể, tất cả, chung, phổ thông, phổ biến; vạn năng.
examples: a universal truth
Love and relationships will always be a topic of universal interest

definition:
the whole of space and everything in it, including the earth, the planets and the stars
    Vũ trụ, vạn vật; thế giới, thiên hạ, thế gian
examples: There are many theories of how the universe began
Is there intelligent life elsewhere in the universe?

definition:
(of petrol/gas) not containing lead2 ( and therefore less harmful to the environment
    (xăng) không pha chì
examples: Cars these days all use unleaded petrol

definition: không có người lái
examples: an unmanned spacecraft
an unmanned mission to the planet Mars

definition:
having no equal; better or greater than any other
    Vô song, không thể sánh kịp, không thể bì kịp, không gì bằng
    Chưa hề có, chưa từng có.
examples: They enjoyed success on a scale unparalleled by any previous rock band

definition:
not enjoyable or pleasant
    Khó ưa, xấu, khó chịu, đáng ghét
examples: an unpleasant experience

definition:
that has never happened, been done or been known before
    Không hề có; chưa hề thấy, chưa từng nghe thấy; vô tiền khoáng hậu

definition:
not having or causing problems
    không gây rắc rối, không tạo ra vấn đề hay khó khăn gì

    thiếu thực tế, không tưởng

Expecting four year old children to sit quietly for a whole hour is just completely unrealistic.

definition:
not fair; expecting too much
    Vô lý, đòi hỏi quá mức

definition:
not connected; not related to something else
    [synonym] unconnected
    Không có liên quan

definition:
(of a problem or question) not yet solved or answered; not having been resolved
    Chưa được giải quyết (vấn đề), chưa được giải đáp (thắc mắc).

definition:
not having or needing special skills or training
    không có chuyên môn, không có kỹ thuật (công nhân)

unskilled work
opposite skilled

definition:
(of a place) beautiful because it has not been changed or built on
    (cảnh quan) vẫn còn giữ nguyên vẻ đẹp tự nhiên, chưa bị tác động bởi con người
examples: unspoiled countryside

definition:
that cannot be continued at the same level, rate, etc
    [opposite] sustainable
    không bền vững, không thể duy trì lâu dài được
examples: unsustainable growth

definition:
the way in which a child is cared for and taught how to behave while it is growing up
    Sự giáo dục, sự dạy dỗ (trẻ con).

definition:
connected with a town or city
    (liên quan đến) thành phố, đô thị
examples: damage to both urban and rural environments
urban development (= the process of building towns and cities or making them larger)

definition:
the process in which towns, streets, factories, etc
    are built where there was once countryside
    Sự thành thị hoá
examples: a time of rapid urbanization and industrialization

definition:
the process in which towns, streets, factories, etc
    are built where there was once countryside
    the process in which more and more people start to live and work in towns and cities rather than in the country
    sự đô thị hoá
examples: a time of rapid urbanization and industrialization
the increasing urbanization of Africans

definition:
to strongly advise or try to persuade someone to do a particular thing
    Thúc, thúc giục, giục giã

definition:
easy for people who are not experts to use or understand
    Dễ sử dụng cho những người không chuyên môn; không khó, không gây e ngại (nhất là về máy tính, phần mềm của nó )
examples: What can we do to make the museum more user-friendly?

definition:
relating to or aiming for a perfect society in which everyone works well with each other and is happy
    xã hội lý tưởng, xã hội hoàn hảo, xã hội không tưởng
examples: utopian idealsa utopian society

definition:
based on what is logical or true
    Vững chắc, có căn cứ
examples: She had valid reasons for not supporting the proposals.
The point you make is perfectly valid.

definition:
an area of low land between hills or mountains, often with a river running through it
    thung lũng
examples: a small town set in a valley
a wooded valley

definition:
to think that somebody/something is important
    Trọng, chuộng, quý, coi trọng

definition:
a person who deliberately destroys or damages public property
    Người cố tình phá hoại tài sản công hoặc tài sản của người khác

definition:
the crime of intentionally damaging property belonging to other people
    tội cố tình phá hoại tài sản của người khác hoặc phá hoại của công

definition:
to intentionally damage property belonging to other people
    phá hoại của công / phá hoại tài sản của người khác một cách có chủ ý
examples: When I got back, my car had been vandalized.

definition:
gas or extremely small drops of liquid that result from the heating of a liquid or solid
    Hơi, hơi nước

definition:
a change, especially in the amount or level of something
    Sự biến đổi, sự thay đổi
    Sự khác nhau, sự sai nhau.

definition:
containing or changing between several different things or types
    Lắm vẻ; đầy những đổi thay.

definition:
several different sorts of the same thing
    nhiều thứ đa dạng, mớ, vài

definition:
plants in general, or plants that are found in a particular area
    Cây cối, cây cỏ, thực vật

definition:
(rather formal) a thing that is used for transporting people or goods from one place to another, such as a car or lorry/truck
    Xe, xe cộ.
    Phương tiện giao thông và vận tải (nói chung)
examples: motor vehicles (= cars, buses, lorries/trucks, etc

rows of parked vehicles

definition:
a business project or activity, especially one that involves taking risks
    thương vụ, phi vụ làm ăn (đặc biệt là những thương vụ có yếu tố mạo hiểm)

definition:

    nơi tổ chức, địa điểm tổ chức sự kiện
examples: The band will be playing at 20 different venues on their UK tour

definition:
to express your feelings or ideas in words
    Phát biểu bằng lời nói

definition:
the act of showing or checking that something is true or accurate

definition:
to check that something is true or accurate
    Thẩm tra, kiểm tra lại

examples: We have no way of verifying his story.

On farms the fox is considered vermin and treated as such

definition:

definition:
= vet :a person who has been trained in the science of animal medicine, whose job is to treat animals who are sick or injured
    bác sĩ thú y
examples: We had to take the dog to the local vet (veterinarian)

The cat injured her paw, so I took her to the vet.

definition:
that can be done; that will be successful
    [synonym] feasible
    Có thể thành tựu được (kế hoạch)
examples: In order to make the company viable, it will unfortunately be necessary to reduce staffing levels.

definition:
a person who has been attacked, injured or killed as the result of a crime, a disease, an accident, etc
    nạn nhân
examples: victims of crime

definition:
to go against or refuse to obey a law, an agreement, etc.

examples: to violate international law

definition:
the act of going against or refusing to obey a law, an agreement, etc

definition:

    (máy tính) Ảo, chỉ có thể được nhìn thấy qua máy tính
examples: New technology has enabled development of an online ‘virtual library’
virtual shopping

definition:
an idea or a picture in your imagination
    Viễn cảnh, hình ảnh muốn thấy trong tương lai
examples: He had a vision of a world in which there would be no wars

definition:
the arts of painting and sculpture, rather than literature and music
    [Nghệ thuật thị giác] hay [Nghệ thuật trực quan] - hình thức nghệ thuật tạo ra các sản phẩm bắt nguồn tự nhiên, chủ yếu tác động vào thị giác như đồ gốm, ký họa, hội họa, điêu khắc, kiến trúc, đồ họa in ấn và các nghệ thuật thị giác hiện đại (nhiếp ảnh, phim video và làm phim), thiết kế và thủ công mĩ nghệ
examples: The visual arts are art forms such as ceramics, drawing, painting, sculpture, printmaking, design, crafts, photography, video, filmmaking, and architecture
Many artistic disciplines (performing arts, conceptual art, textile arts) involve aspects of the visual arts as well as arts of other types
Also included within the visual arts1 are the applied arts2 such as industrial design, graphic design, fashion design, interior design and decorative art

definition:
to form a picture of somebody/something in your mind
    [synonym] imagine
    Hình dung, mường tượng (vật không thấy trước mắt).
examples: Try to visualize him as an old man

definition:
necessary or essential in order for something to succeed or exist,extremely important
    Sống còn, quan trọng
examples: Reading is of vital importance in language learning.
It's absolutely vital that you do exactly as I say.

definition:
weak and easily hurt physically or emotionally
    dễ bị tổn thương
examples: Old people are particularly vulnerable to the flu

definition:
a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
    Tiền lương được trả, thường là mỗi tuần, cho nhân viên, đặc biệt là những người làm việc đòi hỏi kỹ năng hoặc sức mạnh thể chất chứ không phải là công việc cần có bằng đại học
examples: a very low/high wage
an hourly/daily/weekly/annual wage
He gets/earns/is paid a good wage, because he works for a fair employer.
The job pays very low wages.

definition:
the part of the body above and slightly narrower than the hips
    Chỗ eo,chỗ thắt lưng
examples: He put his arm around her waist.
These trousers are a bit tight around my waist.

definition:
alarge building for storing things before they are sold, used, or sent out to shops, or
    Kho hàng
examples: The goods have been sitting in a warehouse for months because a strike has prevented distribution

definition:
materials that are no longer needed and are thrown away
    Vật thải ra, vật vô giá trị không dùng nữa
examples: household/industrial waste
toxic wastes
waste disposal (= the process of getting rid of waste)

definition:
not allowing water to go through
    Không thấm nước
examples: Treat them with oil to make them waterproof.
a waterproof jacket

definition:
the damage that happens to an object in ordinary use during a period
    sự hao mòn và hư hỏng
examples: The insurance policy does not cover damage caused by normal wear and tear.
The living-room carpet has to stand up to the combined wear and tear of two dogs and three children.

definition:
to become, or make something become, gradually thinner or smoother by continuously using or rubbing it
    bào mòn đi, xóa mờ đi
examples: The inscription on the coin had worn away
The steps had been worn away by the feet of thousands of people.

definition:
to measure how heavy somebody/something is, usually by using scales
    to consider something carefully before making a decision
    Cân, nhấc xem nặng nhẹ
    Cân nhấc, đắn đo.
examples: He weighed himself on the bathroom scales
You must weigh up the pros and cons (= consider the advantages and disadvantages of something)
She weighed up all the evidence.

definition:
having no weight or appearing to have no weight, for example because there is no gravity
    Không nặng, không có trọng lượng
examples: Astronauts work in weightless conditions

definition:
the fact of having or appearing to have no weight, for example because there is no gravity
    Tình trạng phi trọng lượng.
    Tìng trạng phi trọng lực.
examples: an experience of weightlessness

definition:
having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject or things in general
    Có đủ tài liệu, biết rõ; thạo tin
examples: He was well informed and shrewd, with good, calm judgment.
How well informed is the customer about the range, quality, and cost of the products on offer?

definition:
of or for the selling of goods in large amounts at low prices to shops and businesses, rather than the selling of goods in shops to customers
    bán buôn, bán sỉ
examples: wholesale prices
a wholesale supplier/business
We only sell wholesale, not to the public.

definition:
to become, or to make something greater in width
    Rộng ra, mở ra
    Làm cho rộng ra, nới rộng ra, mở rộng.
examples: As it approaches the sea, the river begins to widen

definition:
existing or happening over a large area or among many people
    Lan rộng, phổ biến
examples: widespread damage

definition:
having a curving and twisting shape
    uốn khúc, quanh co, ngoằn ngoèo (sông, đường)
examples: a long and winding road

definition:
a building with machinery for grinding grain into flour that is driven by the power of the wind turning long arms (called sails
    Cối xay gió; máy xay gió

using a system of radio signals rather than wires to connect computers, mobile phones, etc
    to each other
    Không dây, rađiô
examples: a wireless connection

definition:
an area of trees, smaller than a forest
    rừng
examples: an oak wood

definition:
made of wood
    Bằng gỗ.
examples: a wooden box
The house was surrounded by a tall, wooden fence
Stir the mixture with a wooden spoon.

definition:
a computer that runs a programfor preparing documents and letters
    máy tính có chương trình soạn thảo văn bản

the principle that hard work is a good habit and should be rewarded
    dịch từng chữ thì nó là “đạo đức công việc”, nhưng thực ra nghĩa đúng nhất là “tinh thần làm việc”
examples: Bill's work ethic was never very strong
Người có work ethic tốt (good work ethic) là người siêng năng làm việc, làm việc chân thật, chất lượng cao
Good work ethic là một cum từ thường thấy trong các quảng cáo tìm nhân viên.

definition:
all the people in a country or an area who are available for work
    Lực lượng lao động
examples: A quarter of the local workforce is/are unemployed.
an educated workforce

definition:
the office, factory, etc
    where people work
    cơ quan, văn phòng, nơi làm việc
examples: the introduction of new technology into the workplace
These safety standards apply to all workplaces.

definition:
a period of discussion and practical work on a particular subject, in which a group of people share their knowledge and experience
    một buổi thảo luận và thực hành về một chủ đề cụ thể, trong đó một nhóm người chia sẻ kiến thức và kinh nghiệm
examples: a drama workshop
a poetry workshop

definition:
existing or happening in all parts of the world
    trên khắp thế giới
examples: We have 2 000 members worldwide
In her new job she travels worldwide as a consultant
The band is famous worldwide.

definition:
useful, important, or good enough to be a suitable reward for the money or time spent or the effort made
    Quan trọng, thú vị hoặc đáng bỏ thời gian, tiền của hoặc nỗ lực; đáng giá; bõ công.
examples: The smile on her face made it all worthwhile.
If you need him on this project, you've got to make it financially worthwhile for him
She considers teaching a worthwhile career.

definition:
to cover something completely in paper or other material, for example when you are giving it as a present
    Bao, bao bọc, bao phủ, gói, quấn
examples: He spent the evening wrapping up the Christmas presents.
individually wrapped chocolates

definition:
the total amount of crops, profits, etc
    that are produced
    Sản lượng, hoa lợi (thửa ruộng); hiệu suất (máy
    )
examples: Crop yields have risen steadily
Yields on gas and electricity shares are consistently high.

definition:
a long vegetable with dark green skin and white flesh
    quả bí ngồi
